meta_description.0: This tasty tortellini soup is loaded with vegetables like asparagus and peas, and is topped with zesty pesto! It comes together in 35 minutes, start to finish. Use what’s on hand whether it's fresh, frozen, or from the pantry.
meta_description.1: Easy weeknight mushroom risotto that’s special enough for occasions, too! The Instant Pot makes it fast, and fail-safe. Plus we have a hack that lets you time your dinner perfectly!
meta_description.2: Pad Thai goes vegetarian! Crispy pan-seared tofu is your protein, and salt takes the place of fish sauce for a vegetarian spin on this favorite takeout dish.
meta_description.3: These Buffalo Cauliflower Tacos are a great meat-free main—all the flavor of buffalo wings, but made with cauliflower! Top these easy tacos with vegan ranch dressing and serve.
meta_description.4: Infinitely versatile, these Black Rice Bowls with Tofu and Veggies with a miso dressing are SO GOOD! They make a satisfying lunch or dinner for vegans, vegetarians, and carnivores alike.
meta_description.5: The BEST Vegetarian Chili! Make it with eggplant, plum tomatoes, onion, garlic, zucchini, bell peppers, jalapeños, white beans, kidney beans, and cilantro. You won't miss the meat!
meta_description.6: Tacos and pasta! Why didn't we put these two together before? This one-skillet dish full of Southwestern flavors and pasta comes together in a flash with pantry staples. Your new favorite weeknight go-to!
meta_description.7: A lighter version of bowtie pasta with peas and prosciutto, no cream, but instead tossed with Parmesan, olive oil, and arugula.
meta_description.8: This Shrimp Orzo with Olives and Tomatoes is a perfect easy midweek dinner with shrimp, black olives, fresh tomatoes, capers, garlic, arugula, and orzo pasta.
meta_description.9: Check out these Chorizo-Stuffed Sweet Potatoes! That's right: Russets aren't the only potatoes worth stuffing! Here, we're stuffing roasted sweet potatoes with a mixture of spicy chorizo, tangy cotija cheese, peppers, and onions.
meta_description.10: Leeks, peas, asparagus, turnips, and white wine turn this Pressure Cooker Lamb Stew into a spring event!
meta_description.11: Looking for a light and refreshing salad? Try this Shrimp Cobb Salad with a little tropical flair from mangoes and the salty bite of cotija cheese.
meta_description.12: Here's a new riff on classic meatloaf with bourbon BBQ glaze! The secret to tender meatloaf? Mince your veggies and give them a quick sauté before mixing them into the meatloaf. You'll love it!
meta_description.13: These chicken skillet enchiladas are easy to make and ready in 30 minutes. They also use only one pan and are great to double and freeze for a meal down the road!
meta_description.14: Chicken, lemongrass, and sweet potatoes on their own are pretty great, but when simmered in coconut milk and topped with chopped cilantro, they become pure magic in this Vietnamese Curry.
meta_description.15: This easy Creamy Chicken Noodle Soup skips the roux, cuts the cream, and gets a healthy protein and vitamin boost with the help of puréed cannellini beans. All of the flavor and creaminess, with none of the guilt!
meta_description.16: Ready for some seriously spicy fried chicken? Hot sauce in the buttermilk marinade and cayenne in the breading means you're headed toward seriously spicy bliss.
meta_description.17: Crispy skillet chicken is cooked in a flavorful lemon broth and served on a bed of Swiss chard, potatoes, and carrots. This bistro-style oven braised chicken with vegetables has everything you love about cozy comfort food.
meta_description.18: Impress your friends and family with Chicken Cordon Bleu! Thin chicken breast is topped with prosciutto and Swiss cheese, then rolled, breaded, pan-fried, and baked to crispy golden perfection. Dinner never tasted so good!
meta_description.19: Chicken Freezer Burritos are your answer to a quick, family-friendly weeknight meal! They're easy to make and delicious (when reheated correctly!). Here's everything you need to know about how to make freezer burritos you'll actually want to eat!
meta_description.20: Want to know the secret to crispy chicken skin? Grilled Chicken Under a Brick! No actual brick required, just something heavy. Get ready for weeknight chicken dinner perfection!
meta_description.21: Need dinner in a hurry? Chinese 5-Spice Skillet Dinner to the rescue! Lean protein, loads of colorful vegetables, and on the table in about 30 minutes!
meta_description.22: Want a perfect fall weeknight meal? These Apple Cider Chicken Thighs are it. Simmered in the oven with sweet potatoes and onions, it's a one-pot skillet dinner that'll fill you up without stressing you out.
meta_description.23: Enjoy the flavors of tamales without all of the work. Rather than individual tamales wrapped in corn husks, we made a pie! Use rotisserie chicken and canned green chiles to make the recipe even easier.
meta_description.24: Get your forks ready and dig into this Tex Mex take on the comfort food classic Shepherd’s Pie. It’s spicy, cheesy and loaded with chicken, beans, and corn, then topped with creamy mashed potatoes. You’re looking at pure weeknight dinner deliciousness.
meta_description.25: If you've never had Feta-Brined Roast Chicken before, you are in for the surprise of your life, because it's THAT GOOD. All other chicken roasting methods should bow before it.
meta_description.26: Here's a classic Southern jambalaya recipe based on historical versions of the recipe. It comes from Toni Tipton-Martin's cookbook Jubilee, which celebrates 200 years of African American cooking!
meta_description.27: Did we say sweet tea? And fried chicken? Yes, we did! Two traditional foods of the South come together here: The sweet tea works as a brine to make this fried chicken extra juicy and extra flavorful.
meta_description.28: This Buffalo Chicken Chili is the best of two game day classics: buffalo chicken wings and chili! Top your bowl with sour cream, tortilla chips, chopped green onions, cheese, and extra buffalo sauce for a new Super Bowl favorite. (Slow cooker and Instant Pot directions, too!)
meta_description.29: Got wings left over from a night out, game day party, or midnight snack? Make luscious, chicken wing ramen with a perfect jammy egg—all in your Instant Pot!
meta_description.30: This Chopped Chicken Salad is easy to put together and filling enough to eat for dinner! Made with fennel, mandarin oranges, avocado, and a flavorful miso dressing, it's perfect for winter but also endlessly adaptable to the seasons.
meta_description.31: Have you ever tried making Indian biryani at home? There's something magical that happens when you combine chicken, rice, a number of spices and you infuse it with cardamom pods, saffron, and top the whole thing with fried onions.
meta_description.32: Chicken fajitas are made even simpler and easier with this sheet pan recipe! A quick marinade makes the chicken tasty and tender. Serve it right from the pan for an easy Tex-Mex family favorite.
meta_description.33: This Skillet Chicken and Rice is a classic one-pot meal, perfect for a weeknight and totally kid-friendly. Serve it on its own or with a salad, and dinner is done!
meta_description.34: Need something quick and delicious for dinner? This Southwest Skillet Chicken is easy, freezer-friendly, and ready in 35 minutes. Make it with beans, corn, and bell peppers!
meta_description.35: This tender, fall-apart corned beef will make your St. Patrick’s Day dinner the talk of the town! Serve it with cabbage, potatoes, and carrots to make your holiday dinner complete.
meta_description.36: Whether we're talking a casual movie night with the family or Super Bowl Sunday, these Loaded Sheet Pan Nachos are ready to party! They come together quickly and easily, and are so much fun to each straight from the pan.
meta_description.37: Corned beef and cabbage is a classic St. Patrick’s Day meal. Make it even easier by cooking the corned beef, cabbage, carrots, and potatoes in the Instant Pot or pressure cooker.
meta_description.38: Looking for a quick, healthy, and satisfying weeknight dinner or workday lunch? These steak noodle bowls are bursting with crunchy sugar snap peas and cucumbers then finished with a zippy miso-lime dressing. All this goodness in under 30 minutes.
meta_description.39: Reuben casserole is a great way to use up leftover corned beef or to make a quick weeknight meal using pastrami from the deli. It has all the flavor of a Reuben sandwich, but very little hands-on time. Just mix it together, and pop it in the oven!
meta_description.40: Tangy, garlicky, and savory—this Greek meatloaf gets flavor boosts from spinach, feta and pomegranate molasses, a common ingredient in Mediterranean food.
meta_description.41: Pork and beef meatballs stuffed with melty, gooey mozzarella, swimming in a rich tomato sauce makes for a filling weeknight meal! The best part? This recipe is on the table in 40 minutes.
meta_description.42: Pot Roast with gravy is comfort food at its finest. Put it in a slow cooker to make all of your chilly winter dreams come true. Carrots, potatoes, and mushrooms cook low and slow along with the roast while you’re at work. Dinner is ready when you are!
meta_description.43: Want a great burger cooked on the stovetop? These double-stacked cheeseburgers are what your cravings desire: thin, tender patties, melty cheese, and a generous amount of secret sauce. Don't forget a napkin!
meta_description.44: This Healthy Shepherd's Pie calls for olive oil instead of butter, extra-lean ground beef, lots of vegetables, and a cauliflower-potato mash topping for a lighter take on the classic that's still FULL of flavor!
meta_description.45: Let the spicy flavors of Thailand tempt your taste buds! Tom Yum Soup is a quick, easy, and healthy weeknight recipe. This version is made with shrimp, but feel free to add the seafood of your choice.
meta_description.46: You don’t need to travel to Maryland for delicious, easy-to-make crab cakes. Make them in the comfort of your own home in about 30 minutes. Serve them on a bed of lettuce or a bun, just don’t forget the lemon wedges!
meta_description.47: Consider yourself transported to the Mediterranean! This gorgeous skillet dinner is bursting with tomatoes, anise-scented fennel, white beans, and vibrant shrimp.
meta_description.48: Chunks of lamb, browned, and simmered in milk and cream with fennel and garlic. Spin off of a traditional Italian milk-braised pork dish.
meta_description.49: Spicy lamb stew with butternut squash! Lean lamb shoulder braised in tomato sauce with butternut squash, garbanzo beans, and garlic. Spiced with paprika, cayenne, and black pepper.
meta_description.50: Lamb shanks are melt in your mouth delicious braised with celery root, cabbage, and rosemary. Cut the meat away from the bones and serve like a stew!
meta_description.51: Lamb Stew with Chickpeas! Spicy and warm. Perfect winter comfort food. Cinnamon, cumin, coriander, and a hit of cayenne.
meta_description.52: This Ginger Pork Rice Bowl is just so good! You can't go wrong with savory, garlicky pork mixed with rice and loads of crunchy veggies. Your kids will love it, too!
meta_description.53: Cuban-style roast pork is marinated in a garlicky-citrus mojo sauce to deliver flavorful, succulent meat. Cuban pork is easy to make, and the best part is you can use the leftovers to make Cuban sandwiches. Go ahead—wow your family two nights in a row!
meta_description.54: Pepperoni pizza in your hand, literally! These pizza pockets are like your own personal hot pocket, but homemade. Think of them like a calzone, but with a much flakier crust.
meta_description.55: Here's how to make the BEST Traditional Cuban Sandwich, a.k.a. the Cubano, at home! Layers of mojo-marinated pork roast, ham, cheese, and pickles make this sandwich outstanding. Serve toasted grilled bread sandwich hot or cold!
meta_description.56: SPAM is very underrated. Slice it into strips and get it crispy in a hot skillet, then make these SPAM tacos! Topped with pineapple and red pepper, these tacos are truly delicious.
meta_description.57: These smothered pork chops really hit the spot. Thick cut pork chops are pan seared and smothered in onion gravy — just what you need to chase away the winter blues. Make it a meal and serve it over mashed potatoes!
meta_description.58: Classic Italian-American linguine with clam sauce with fresh and canned clams, tomatoes and fennel
meta_description.59: Fettuccine pasta with a rich and creamy, tomato and Italian sausage sauce.  Absolute crowd pleaser.
meta_description.60: Chicken and pasta and cheese, oh my! Zucchini gives this weeknight meal some veggie love, and the best part? The whole thing cooks in one skillet, minimizing the mess.
meta_description.61: Spaghetti and meatballs is such a comfort food classic! The meatballs are made from ground beef and Italian sausage, served with a sauce with mushrooms, onions, basil, and Parmesan. Dig in!
meta_description.62: Easy 30-min dinner! Shrimp sautéed in olive oil with ginger, garlic, and colorful red and green bell pepper, tossed with angel hair pasta.
meta_description.63: Sautéed shrimp with caramelized lemons, tossed with shallots, spinach and linguine. Delicious!
meta_description.64: A warm bowl of ramen need not be a big ordeal of time or fuss, as this weeknight chicken ramen attests. Boost store-bought chicken broth with some flavor enhancers and assemble your bowls in under 30 minutes.
meta_description.65: Chili mac and cheese! Take two comfort food favorites and combine them into one cheesy skillet. Not too spicy, so perfect for a family meal (add hot sauce if you like heat!).
meta_description.66: Pasta Pomodoro—angel hair pasta tossed with sautéed shrimp, garlic, tomatoes, and basil. Only 30 minutes!
meta_description.67: Quick, easy, and surprisingly delicious, pasta with wilted arugula and a sauce made of olive oil, garlic, red pepper flakes and canned tuna.
meta_description.68: Easy to make! Pasta with sauce of tuna, tomato, garlic, shallots, olives, parsley.
meta_description.69: Perfect for summer! Angel hair pasta with shallots, garlic, chopped clams, cherry tomatoes, and basil
meta_description.70: Citrus Pork with Egg Noodles is quick and easy, perfect for a midweek dinner! With strips of pork loin sautéed with cumin and garlic, served in a citrusy sauce with carrots and egg noodles.
meta_description.71: Sautéed cauliflower, onions, and bacon, tossed with pasta, Parmesan and toasted panko. So good!
meta_description.72: Pasta with shrimp, artichoke hearts, basil pesto, and peas. A great quick, pull-together meal.
meta_description.73: Pasta dinner with turkey meatballs and roasted vegetables. Toss with olive oil, lemon juice, and parsley. Quick, easy, and satisfying. Ready in about 30 minutes.
meta_description.74: Roast your chicken on top of angel hair pasta for a 2-in-1 meal! The pan drippings make an amazing sauce for the pasta.
meta_description.75: Butternut squash, bacon, and browned butter are made for each other. Pasta brings it all together, and the sage adds an earthy element. Make this for dinner tonight—or for when company comes!
meta_description.76: Shell pasta with sausage and greens, made with shell pasta, Italian sausage, and kale or broccoli rabe.
meta_description.77: Lemon chicken is the perfect meal for two! We marinated it in yogurt to make it tender, then served over pasta tossed with fresh herbs. This dinner is easy to prep, easy to cook, and loaded with flavor.
meta_description.78: Homemade alfredo on a weeknight? Yes! You can have this super kid-friendly Chicken Alfredo on the table in 25 minutes. Rotisserie chicken makes it a snap, or you could use leftover chicken.
meta_description.79: This Sausage and Kale Orecchiette is a great weeknight meal. It uses just a few ingredients and can be made quickly. Great for kids, too!
meta_description.80: Good old-fashioned chicken Parmesan gets the skillet treatment in this one-pot dish. Serve with rice or spaghetti for comfort food at its finest—and fastest!
meta_description.81: A take-out favorite comes home for dinner. Here's our version of Pad Thai with chicken. A little prep goes a long way and makes this dish an easy stovetop dinner. You can do this!
meta_description.82: Cubed chicken sautéed in olive oil, served with pasta in a creamy sauce infused with thyme, mint, and honey.
meta_description.83: Orecchiette pasta tossed with roasted cauliflower, roasted cherry tomatoes, prosciutto, arugula, and Parmesan.
meta_description.84: Pasta tossed with Italian sausage, roasted red bell peppers, olives, capers, fresh tomato and basil
meta_description.85: Fresh mussels steamed in tomato sauce and served over pasta is the ultimate comfort food! Luckily, fresh mussels are readily available these days AND they are easy to prepare.
meta_description.86: Bright green kale and walnut pesto makes this a kid-friendly dinner into a nutritional powerhouse. Boost the protein by adding lemon pepper chicken.
meta_description.87: This easy tortellini soup is loaded with Italian sausage, spinach, and cheese-filled pasta. The short ingredient list makes this soup the perfect weeknight dinner. It's light on the cream but rich in flavor, with an added protein boost from puréed cannellini beans.
meta_description.88: Thai green curry with sautéed asian eggplant, red bell peppers, lemongrass, and coconut milk.
meta_description.89: Italian pumpkin gnocchi dumplings made with pumpkin or winter squash, ricotta cheese, parmesan and flour.
meta_description.90: What could make mac & cheese even better? Taking it on a southwestern spin with roasted green chiles, corn, and jack cheese!
meta_description.91: Classic asparagus risotto made with arborio rice, shallots, stock, fresh asparagus, and Parmesan cheese.
meta_description.92: Cheesy Tortellini Casserole is like lasagna, minus all the time and effort. Just boil some tortellini, mix with tomato sauce, top with cheese, and bake until bubbly. Dinner is ready!
meta_description.93: Pressure Cooker Butternut Squash Soup! Steam the whole squash in a pressure cooker like the Instant Pot, then puree it with onion, celery, carrot, apples, and broth. Quick and easy.
meta_description.94: Vegan stuffed squash with brown rice and mushrooms! Use acorn squash or other winter squash. Vegan or vegetarian main course.
meta_description.95: Asian noodle salad with plenty of colorful veggies and a sesame ginger dressing.
meta_description.96: Want a real show-stopper? Make this Butternut Squash Lasagna! Layers of squash, noodles, cheese sauce, and spinach. It's easy to make ahead (or freeze!) and will satisfy a large crowd.
meta_description.97: Perfect comfort food! Cheesy mac and cheese with sharp cheddar, parmesan, and broccoli.
meta_description.98: Cheesy lasagna with pesto and greens! Great make-ahead meal for the fridge or freezer.
meta_description.99: Weeknight potato and broccoli curry! Ground almonds are the secret to a creamy sauce without the cream. Prepped and ready to eat in about 40 minutes.
meta_description.100: This Slow Cooker Chickpea Curry a "set it and forget it" meal. Just pile all the ingredients into the slow cooker and come back to a hot meal hours later. Soak your chickpeas overnight to make them extra tender.
meta_description.101: Spinach Risotto! Simple easy risotto with fresh baby spinach, stock, Parmesan and lemon
meta_description.102: Burrito Bowl! With black beans, rice, avocados, salsa, red cabbage, and lime.
meta_description.103: Delicious vegan curry with cauliflower, chickpeas, onion, tomato, and cilantro.
meta_description.104: Healthy and satisfying weeknight frittata with potatoes, onions, red peppers, spinach, and ground turmeric.
meta_description.105: This vegan Turkish lentil stew recipe with eggplant and pomegranate molasses is hearty, filling and delicious!
meta_description.106: Sweet-sour eggplant caponata makes a great sauce for pasta. Simple vegetarian dinner.
meta_description.107: Yellow split pea soup with Indian curry spices. Bright, flavorful, and filling! Vegetarian and gluten-free.
meta_description.108: Mediterranean chickpea bowls with creamy tahini sauce! Made with spiced chickpeas, spinach, cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, and brown rice. Great make-ahead meal for lunches or dinners.
meta_description.109: Green chile enchiladas! These are made with corn tortillas stuffed with roasted green chiles and jack cheese, then smothered with roasted tomatillo salsa verde. Great as a make-ahead meal or freezer meal.
meta_description.110: Easy vegetarian frittata with shredded zucchini, potatoes, feta, and Monterey jack cheese. Makes great leftovers.
meta_description.111: Butternut Squash Pasta with Parmesan! Pasta served with a homemade butternut squash pasta sauce of roasted butternut squash, shallots, cream, and Parmesan cheese.
meta_description.112: Welcome to Eat Your Food! It's our recipe column with real meals for real kids. This broccoli and cheddar quesadilla may just make a believer out of your kids—and the spicy pico de gallo keeps it interesting for adventurous kids and adults alike.
meta_description.113: Classic Italian potato gnocchi recipe. How to make gnocchi, or light potato dumplings, made with baking potatoes, egg yolks, and flour.
meta_description.114: Skip the wait for take-out, and make this Easy Vegetable Stir Fried Rice instead! It uses up a mess of vegetables along with leftover rice and some eggs for protein, and it's ready in a half an hour.
meta_description.115: Vegan Mushroom Barley Soup! Add soy sauce, balsamic, a mix of dried and fresh mushrooms, and spinach for a modern take on this classic recipe.
meta_description.116: Four-cheese lasagna! Ricotta, Parmesan, Mozzarella, and Fontina make this filling for this rustic, free-form lasagna. Fresh pasta sheets are best, but no-boil dry noodles can also be used.
meta_description.117: Fettuccine alfredo with mushrooms brings a mix of cheesy, creamy and earthy flavors together. It's a restaurant-worthy dish you can totally make at home.
meta_description.118: This Roasted Eggplant and Butternut Squash with Tahini-Yogurt Sauce is a fantastic vegetarian main course. Make it for the holidays or dinner parties. Roast everything on one sheet pan.
meta_description.119: Spinach and Artichoke Sheet Pan Pizza! You just need one ball of pizza dough, jarred artichokes, wilted spinach, and CHEESE! Easy weeknight meal and great for a crowd.
meta_description.120: Spaghetti squash, first baked, then shredded and sautéed with chard, garlic, rosemary, and Parmesan. Easy vegetarian side or main!
meta_description.121: Creamy Tomato Bean Soup without any cream! Takes only 30 minutes to make. With Tomatoes, onions, white beans, Parmesan, and basil.
meta_description.122: Sautéed mushrooms on toast and topped with a fried egg make a satisfying meat-free meal on days when you need something easy. Make it for breakfast, lunch, or dinner — it's good any time of day!
meta_description.123: Easy vegetarian Cauliflower Curry with lots of anti-inflammatory Turmeric! With cauliflower, potatoes, tomatoes, and peas. 30 minutes.
meta_description.124: Quick and easy caprese pita pizzas, cooked in a skillet! With tomatoes, mozzarella, basil, and pita bread.
meta_description.125: SUPER creamy dairy-free soup made of pureed celeriac, cauliflower, almonds and garlic. Serve as vegan starter or main dish.
meta_description.126: Spinach ricotta gnocchi! Italian dumplings made with ricotta cheese, spinach, flour, and egg, served with a tomato goat cheese sauce.
meta_description.127: Brown butter makes everything taste better, especially this pasta with spinach and mushrooms. It's a quick and easy dinner!
meta_description.128: This hearty Three Sisters Casserole is made with corn, beans, and squash, and topped with cornbread biscuits. It makes a great meatless main dish or vegetarian side!
meta_description.129: Easy cheesy stuffed bell peppers with quinoa, black beans, cheddar, green onions, and cumin.
meta_description.130: Fresh spring asparagus pesto recipe with baby spinach, asparagus, pine nuts, olive oil and garlic, served with fettuccine pasta.
meta_description.131: Spring Minestrone! A springtime version of the classic Italian minestrone, with peas, new potatoes, artichoke hearts, asparagus and spring greens.
meta_description.132: Cauliflower Pasta Bake with crispy, crunchy Ritz cracker topping! It's like grown-up mac and cheese. Made with roasted cauliflower, onions, Parmesan, and Gouda. So good!
meta_description.133: Harvest Salad with Miso-Maple Roasted Butternut Squash! Toss with greens, apples, cooked grains, pepitas, dried cranberries, and pomegranate arils. Best fall salad EVER. Makes a great lunch, too.
meta_description.134: Think of this Tomato Ricotta Tart like pizza, only better! This tart is crispy from phyllo and loaded with fresh, seasonal tomatoes. Slice 'em into large squares for dinner or small ones for appetizers.
meta_description.135: Summer Vegetable Shakshuka! Poached eggs in a rich tomato and vegetable sauce with pesto. Serve for brunch or light dinner.
meta_description.136: Lemony Spaghetti with Peas and Ricotta! Mix up your pasta night routine with this recipe! Comes together quickly with just a few ingredients.
meta_description.137: Make-Ahead Skillet Baked Spaghetti! Assemble up to a day ahead and bake when ready. Made with yellow squash, cherry tomatoes, Parmesan, fontina cheese, and basil. Yum!
meta_description.138: Think of these zucchini roll-ups like lasagna, but without the pasta! Precooking the zucchini softens it enough to roll it up with some cheese and herbs. Top with a quick fresh stovetop tomato sauce, bake, and serve!
meta_description.139: EASY and FAST Soba Noodle Bowls. With spinach, poached eggs, and sesame seeds. 20 minutes to make.
meta_description.140: Moroccan-spiced vegetable and chickpea stew seasoned with ras el hanout spice mix (cumin, coriander, ginger, and cinnamon). Vegan and gluten-free. 30-minute cooking time.
meta_description.141: This Angel Hair Pasta with Cherry Tomato Sauce is so quick and easy! Ready in about 20 minutes flat, and SO GOOD! Best with fresh summer cherry tomatoes.
meta_description.142: This Balsamic Risotto is rich and tangy with Parmesan cheese and balsamic vinegar, and a great way to use garden tomatoes and basil!
meta_description.143: Looking for an easy meat-free dinner? This roasted delicata squash stuffed with mushrooms and quinoa is so flavorful and satisfying. Delicata is a quick-cooking squash, so this is a great midweek meal!
meta_description.144: White beans and nutritional yeast give this polenta a creamy and cheesy taste, without the dairy. Add some roasted broccoli and a drizzle of chili oil, and you've got an easy, filling meat-free dinner!
meta_description.145: Quick and simple vegetarian dinner of grains, mushrooms, and spinach. Great for lunch, too! 30-minute one-pot meal.
meta_description.146: Pasta? Check. Roasted tomatoes? Check. Creamy vegan cashew sauce? Absolutely CHECK! This recipe is so simple, but it delivers big on both flavor and creaminess. Make the cream sauce ahead of time and dinner is ready in no time.
meta_description.147: Quick and easy chickpea curry with Yukon Gold potatoes, stewed tomatoes, cumin, ginger, coriander and garbanzo beans.
meta_description.148: Who says loaded baked potatoes can't be healthy?! This weeknight recipe tops baked potatoes with a creamy mix of chickpeas and coconut milk! It's vegan, dairy-free, and delicious.
meta_description.149: Flatbread pizza made with naan is quick, easy, and ready in less than 20 minutes. This version is loaded with fresh vegetables and herbs, but you can add any toppings you want. The sky’s the limit!
meta_description.150: This Shepherd's Pie is vegetarian comfort food at its best. Carrots, mushrooms, peas, and green beans bathed in a creamy sauce and topped with cheesy mashed potatoes make a diner's delight!
meta_description.151: A couple of easy ingredient swaps turns classic minestrone into a vegan meal. Veggie stock and almond creamer are the secret weapons that turn this into a comforting weeknight soup.
meta_description.152: Three things make this vegetarian lentil soup so good: caramelized onions, toasted tomato paste (it's easy!), and lots of carrots and celery. Make a big pot to have some now and save some for later—this soup is freezer friendly!
meta_description.153: Shaved asparagus, baby potatoes, and gouda cheese. A perfect spring meal or easy party appetizer. Eat asparagus while it lasts!
meta_description.154: Yes, awesome grilled pizza can be yours for dinner tonight! This version celebrates veggies like broccoli and red peppers. Make your own pizza dough, or take it easy and buy store-bought. Score!
meta_description.155: Casserole of chopped fresh kale, mushrooms, onions, ciabatta bread, cheddar cheese, milk, and eggs.
meta_description.156: Penne with ricotta and asparagus! Simple spring pasta with asparagus, ricotta and Parmesan cheeses, garlic, and a dash of nutmeg.
meta_description.157: Sautéed cubed eggplant with onions, garlic, spinach, mint, tossed with spaghetti pasta and feta
meta_description.158: Fusilli pasta tossed with marinated artichoke hearts, sun-dried tomatoes, and toasted almonds.
meta_description.159: Creamy white beans combine with pesto for these veggie burgers! They make a satisfying meal for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. Top each patty with more pesto and dig in.
meta_description.160: Say hello to grilling season with these flavor-packed veggie burgers! Serve in buns, over salad, or all on their own. Any way you serve them, don't skip the creamy Green Goddess sauce over top!
meta_description.161: Ginormous zucchini in your garden? Try this recipe, hollowed out zucchini, stuffed with basil pesto, fresh croutons, Mozzarella, pine nuts and cherry tomatoes.
meta_description.162: Roasted cauliflower on pizza? Why not?! This sheet pan pizza is a great meat-free dinner any night of the week.
meta_description.163: Think of these as a deconstructed enchilada: warm corn tortillas layered with sweet corn, black beans, cheese, and spicy salsa. They're quicker and easier than traditional enchiladas, great for a weeknight meal!
meta_description.164: This Whole Wheat Pasta with Kale Pesto is a quick and easy meatless dinner! Make your pesto with cashews for extra creaminess. Blanching the kale also helps keep the pesto green.
meta_description.165: Easy Middle Eastern fattoush! Crispy pita chips, fresh vegetables, and a tangy dressing. 30 minutes.
meta_description.166: Cacio e pepe is the most divine pasta dish made with simple, high quality ingredients. Tender noodles tossed in a two-cheese blend and a hint of cream ensure luscious forkfuls. Freshly cracked black pepper adds tiny spicy bursts of flavor with each bite.
meta_description.167: How do you raise an adventurous eater? One who loves veggies and trying new foods? We've got 5 great tips from Vicki and Misha Collins and their new cookbook The Adventurous Eaters Club, plus a VIDEO of making beet gnocchi together!
meta_description.168: It's summer squash season! Try these Stuffed Shells with Yellow Squash and Ricotta for an easy and delicious summertime meal. Easy to make ahead and also freezes well!
meta_description.169: Crispy, cheesy quesadillas come together in just minutes! To make these a more complete meal, we add mushrooms to the mix. They make a quick snack, or a full meal with a salad or soup on the side.
meta_description.170: Sweet corn! Zucchini! Goat cheese! Basil! Fold these up in a quesadilla, and you've got one quick dinner. If you need a super easy meal to make on a hot summer day, this is definitely it.
meta_description.171: It's sweet corn season! Make the most of it with this sweet and creamy Sweet Corn Gnocchi Skillet. Fast, filling, and kid-friendly—it's a win for everyone!
meta_description.172: Spanakopita! Spinach, feta, ricotta, and fresh herbs are encased in layers of flaky, buttery phyllo to create this easy-to-make vegetarian Greek pie. Spanakopita is often folded into triangles, but we opted to make it into a quick and simple casserole. Serve as a side or a vegetarian main course!
meta_description.173: Yes, you can have lasagna in the summer without turning on the oven! This one is layered with lemony ricotta, tomatoes, zucchini, and fresh basil.
meta_description.174: Spinach-Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms are a vegetarian delight that even a die-hard meat eater will enjoy! They’re also gluten-free and suitable for anyone on a keto plan.
meta_description.175: This mac and cheese with fresh basil and artichokes takes the classic to new heights! The sauce is infused with basil and made with a blend of melted cheeses. No roux! (P.S. Your kids will love this, too!)
meta_description.176: Here's a low-carb version of fried rice, loaded with vegetables to satisfy your Chinese takeout cravings. Cauliflower florets are quickly chopped and stir-fried to create a flavorful fried “rice” dish!
meta_description.177: This Cheesy Spaghetti Squash Casserole is loaded with cheese, fresh sage, and roasted red peppers. This vegetarian casserole makes a rich, decadent main dish or the perfect vegetarian holiday side.
meta_description.178: Kick your cauliflower gnocchi up a notch with this creamy sun-dried tomato sauce with fresh herbs makes for a rustic, delicious dish! Regular gnocchi works great, too.
meta_description.179: Butternut squash enchiladas are a vegetarian dinner dream. The slightly sweet combination of squash combined with the rich, earthy spices of ancho chili powder, cumin, and oregano create a sure-to-please vegetarian take on a classic.
meta_description.180: Creamy avocados and savory black beans are a great match. Load them onto a quesadillas, add a mix of cheeses, and dinner is served in minutes! This is such an easy and kid-friendly weeknight dinner.
meta_description.181: These Vegan Sloppy Joes are made with green lentils and a spice blend so good you’ll be licking the plate. You won't miss the meat! Great make-ahead or freezer meal, too.
meta_description.182: Roasted cauliflower “steaks” make a satisfying and filling vegetarian sandwich. This recipe boosts the flavor factor with a quick and easy aioli sauce, sliced tomatoes, and spicy arugula.
meta_description.183: Make a comforting bowl of savory vegetable pot pie, topped with a flaky crust. This version is loaded with tender vegetables and baked with a puff pastry lid for a hearty, individually portioned meal.
meta_description.184: This Classic Tomato Soup is rich with a velvety texture. It’s easy to make with canned tomatoes, and perfectly suited for all of your grilled cheese dipping needs. Better than a can of Campbell's and just about as easy!
meta_description.185: How about a quicker, easier lasagna? Pull pasta and canned tomatoes out of the pantry, frozen spinach from the freezer, pick up some cheese on the way home, and you’re on your way to lasagna in an hour.
meta_description.186: Trader Joe’s gluten-free cauliflower gnocchi has become a popular frozen food kitchen staple. This copycat version uses five ingredients—so easy! Add it to soup, toss with your favorite sauce, or sauté with a little olive oil for a simple Italian dinner.
meta_description.187: Ready to try a new kind of grilled cheese? This Grilled Cheese with Mozzarella, Roasted Red Peppers, and Arugula is sweet, peppery, and too tempting to pass up!
meta_description.188: Mac and cheese goes green with this spinach and basil pesto from cookbook author Maria Lichty of Two Peas and Their Pod. Havarti adds a silky, creamy touch to this comfort food classic.
meta_description.189: Looking for dinner that’s healthy in a hurry? The whole family will love this vegetarian skillet dinner! It’s loaded with the sweet and earthy flavors of roasted butternut squash, black beans, and quinoa, seasoned with cumin and chili powder. The best part? It’s ready, start to finish, in about 45 minutes.
meta_description.190: Chana masala, also called chole masala, is a vegetarian and vegan Indian comfort food packed with flavor and perfect for dinner (or lunch) any day of the week! It also freezes beautifully, so it works well as a make-ahead freezer meal.
meta_description.191: Shakshuka with mixed greens, herbs, onions, garlic, and spices—and eggs that cook right in the pan. Make it for dinner with crispy latkes, and eat the rest for breakfast the next day!
meta_description.192: Barbecued chicken and sweet potatoes in the pressure cooker: the perfect combo for a weeknight dinner. Everything cooks in one pot—including the barbecue sauce!
meta_description.193: Simple and easy, grilled chicken recipe, topped with a tomato tarragon sauce.
meta_description.194: Chicken with Creamy Cassis Sauce! Chicken breasts lightly sautéed and served with a sauce made with cream, white wine, and creme de cassis, a liqueur made from blackcurrants.
meta_description.195: Easy gluten-free and paleo version of Filipino Chicken Adobo! One of my favorite paleo chicken recipes that makes an easy stovetop dinner. Tangy, tasty, perfect with rice!
meta_description.196: Need chicken fast? The pressure cooker is the way to go! This method is fast, simple, and fool proof. Keep the seasoning simple or mix it up depending on how you're serving the chicken.
meta_description.197: Basque-Style Chicken simmered in an easy sauce with roasted chili peppers, ham, tomatoes, garlic, and olives. Makes a warming, hearty dinner on a chilly night.
meta_description.198: Sweet and spicy Firecracker Chicken is a Chinese takeout staple! Make it at home in less time it takes to order and have it delivered.
meta_description.199: Mexican chicken pozole recipe, pozole blanco, traditional dish of Guerrero, Mexico, made with hominy, chicken, and several garnishes.
meta_description.200: Don't have a tagine? Make Moroccan chicken in a slow cooker, it's easy! Chicken thighs, plenty of spices, onions, green olives, lemons, raisins, cooked low and slow until fall apart tender.
meta_description.201: Add a little Argentinian flair to pan-seared skirt steak with a simple avocado chimichurri sauce. The lean and beefy cut cooks in just minutes in a sizzling hot skillet. It’s a quick dinner that will take your taste buds on a South American adventure!
meta_description.202: Lamb and beef meatloaf with Moroccan seasonings, onion, carrot, celery, garlic, ginger, paprika, cumin, coriander, cayenne, cinnamon, cilantro, saffron, and mint.
meta_description.203: Ground beef and porcini grilled burger, topped with Swiss cheese and sautéed onions and shiitake mushrooms.
meta_description.204: Filet mignon steak, pan seared and served with a sauce of a red wine reduction with butter.
meta_description.205: Hamburger and Macaroni! Others call it goulash or even American chop suey. Whatever you call it, it's great for a midweek meal. Browned ground beef cooked in a tomato onion sauce, mixed in with elbow macaroni. So good!
meta_description.206: Tamale pie, classic American comfort food, made with ground beef, onion, bell pepper, tomatoes, Anaheim chiles, corn, olives, raisins, cheddar cheese, and cornbread.
meta_description.207: Sous Vide Beef Tenderloin with Port, Garlic, and Thyme! Fool-proof recipe – I'll never feel anxious cooking beef tenderloin again. Serve for Christmas dinner or a special holiday meal.
meta_description.208: So easy! Penne pasta tossed with a simple tomato sauce with ground beef, onions, Italian seasoning, garlic, and basil. This penne pasta dish is a perfect, budget-friendly, midweek meal that everyone will love.
meta_description.209: To make classic Chicken Fried Steak, pound steak cutlets thin, then bread and fry. Serve with rich country gravy. Chicken Fried Steak is a Southern favorite!
meta_description.210: Everyone needs a recipe for classic beef chili. Make this one your go-to! It's made with corn, peppers, tomatoes, and beans, and makes enough to freeze for later!
meta_description.211: Beef Brisket cooked as a pot roast couldn't be easier. Just sear and then cook it in the oven with onions and garlic all afternoon until it becomes fall-apart tender. The leftovers freeze beautifully, too!
meta_description.212: Easy 3-ingredient Beef Brisket! Here's how to cook beef brisket in oven, slathered in a mixture of BBQ sauce and soy sauce. Just wrap in foil, and bake until falling apart tender. This beef brisket is simple and delicious.
meta_description.213: BEST Meatloaf EVER! Learn to how to make meatloaf with ground beef, pork sausage, onion, celery, garlic, egg, parsley, and breadcrumbs. Homemade meatloaf is a staple. You'll want to keep this classic meatloaf recipe on hand.
meta_description.214: Use your slow cooker to braise short ribs to perfection! They become incredibly tender in mix of beef stock and bourbon, and are terrific served on top of cheesy grits. It's a dish that warms you from the inside out.
meta_description.215: An easy beef stroganoff recipe with tender strips of beef and mushrooms cooked in sour cream and served over noodles. Made with the best beef stroganoff sauce.
meta_description.216: Authentic Cincinnati Chili is a meaty, rich, and uniquely spiced chili from (you guessed it!) Cincinnati, Ohio. It's served over hot spaghetti with your choice of toppings. Don’t forget the cheese and oyster crackers!
meta_description.217: We tested all sorts of methods for mixing, shaping, and grilling backyard burgers, and even talked with grilling expert Steven Raichlen! Here is our take on the perfect grilled burger.
meta_description.218: Everything you love about Shepherd's Pie, but this quick and easy version is made in the pressure cooker! Pressure cook the potatoes on top of the filling, then mash, assemble the casserole and serve. So easy!
meta_description.219: Grilled Carne Asada! Thinly sliced, grilled beef made with marinated, grilled skirt steak or flank steak. Serve with warm tortillas, avocados, and pico de gallo fresh tomato salsa.
meta_description.220: A Chinese takeout favorite—beef with broccoli—cooked with ramen noodles means this is one completely filling meal. And it's on the table in less than 30 minutes!
meta_description.221: Classic Tex Mex fajitas recipe, made with strips of skirt steak, onions and bell peppers, and served sizzling hot with fresh tortillas, guacamole, sour cream, and salsa.
meta_description.222: This classic Chinese Broccoli Beef Stir Fry recipe only 30 minutes from start to finish! Crisp-tender broccoli and tender steak, all decked out in a savory sauce. Serve with rice.
meta_description.223: Carbonnade Belgian beef stew recipe, with beef, onions, and Belgian ale, and seasoned with bay and thyme.
meta_description.224: Not your everyday pot roast recipe! Beef roast braised in red wine, with pancetta, onions, carrots, celery, tomato, and garlic.
meta_description.225: Chili con Carne! With chunks of chuck roast, browned in bacon fat and cooked with red kidney beans, red chili and chipotle chili, onion, garlic, jalapeños, tomatoes, and lime juice. Top with grated cheddar and chopped red onion. So GOOD!
meta_description.226: Classic retro dinner, made in the pressure cooker. Ground beef and rice meatballs in a simple tomato sauce. (No porcupines!) 30 minute dinner.
meta_description.227: Italian pot roast! Rump or chuck beef roast, first browned in olive oil, then slow cooked in a sofritto base of carrots, celery, and onion, with Italian plum tomatoes and red wine.
meta_description.228: These Stuffed Bell Peppers are such a classic. They're made with a mix of ground beef, rice, onions, tomatoes, and spices. No need to pre-cook the filling — just stuff, bake, and serve!
meta_description.229: Try this classic recipe for Steak Diane! "Diane" refers to the pan sauce made with mustard, Worcestershire, cream, and cognac. It's ready in under 30 minutes, making it a great choice for a date night in!
meta_description.230: Easy Beef Stir Fry! With ginger and scallions and a honey soy marinade.
meta_description.231: Instant pot beef chili recipe is ready in under an hour! This version is made with green peppers, onions, celery, ground beef, and tomatoes. Top with shredded cheese and sliced green onions, and serve some cornbread on the side.
meta_description.232: Hamburger stroganoff made with ground beef in a sour cream mushroom sauce, with onions, parsley, paprika, served over egg noodles.
meta_description.233: A California classic, Santa Maria style tri tip beef roast, a triangle shaped bottom sirloin cut, with a peppery, salty, garlic-y crust.
meta_description.234: These classic Italian-American style meatballs are huge and pillowy soft! They're mixed with ground beef and pork, loaded with herbs and cheese, and served with a traditional tomato sauce. Make them baseball-sized for a dinner entree, or roll them smaller for an appetizer.
meta_description.235: Liver and onions! Calves liver, dredged in seasoned flour, sauteed in bacon fat, with thinly sliced onions.
meta_description.236: Classic Salisbury Steak with Mushroom Gravy! It's ready in under an hour and cooks all in one skillet. Just like mom used to make. Serve with buttered noodles or mashed potatoes.
meta_description.237: Marinated skirt steak, threaded onto skewers and grilled, becomes melt-in-your-mouth tender and delicious, with wonderful caramelized bits!
meta_description.238: Classic Steak au Poivre, or steak with a creamy peppercorn sauce
meta_description.239: Rich, meaty Bolognese Sauce is easy to make and can be on the table in 35 minutes. Use it to top pasta noodles, or layer in lasagna. It’s freezer-friendly too. Make a double or triple batch to enjoy all winter long!
meta_description.240: This classic Swiss steak is made with a thick slice of top round steak slow cooked in tomato sauce until completely tender. One steak will easily feed a whole family.
meta_description.241: Cheesy Hamburger Pasta Skillet! Way better than a box mix and just as quick and easy! 1-pot, make it for dinner and have the leftovers for lunch.
meta_description.242: Chili beans are a quick way to get your chili fix! They're ready in under 45 minutes and are great served over rice for an easy weeknight meal. This version is made with ground beef and pinto beans.
meta_description.243: Cheesy Baked Hot Dogs! Take a perennial kid favorite—hot dogs—to the next level by adding cheese and baking them in the oven to crispy, gooey perfection. Some onions and relish help, too.
meta_description.244: Flank steak pounded and stuffed with pesto, wrapped in bacon, rolled into a roulade or pinwheel and roasted.
meta_description.245: Beef goulash with light, fluffy dumplings.  Central European goulash, a beef stew with Hungarian paprika, onions, tomato paste, cubed chuck roast, herbs and stock.
meta_description.246: Traditional roast beef hash! Cooked beef, ground through a meat grinder with onions and potatoes and then fried.
meta_description.247: Tender brisket in half the time with the pressure cooker! Perfect for Passover dinner or Sunday suppers. Easy blender gravy.
meta_description.248: Make a diner classic for dinner tonight - Joe's Special! Scrambled eggs with spinach, beef, onions, garlic, and mushrooms. 30 minutes.
meta_description.249: This Flank Steak Stir Fry comes together quickly with flank steak, asparagus, and red bell peppers. Perfect for a quick midweek dinner!
meta_description.250: Beef stew, quickly prepared with top sirloin steak, white beans, carrots, onions, tomatoes, and mushrooms.
meta_description.251: Korean beef bulgogi bowls are such and easy weeknight meal. Cooking the steak sous vide makes it extra tender and flavorful, too! Top with spicy bulgogi sauce and dinner is ready.
meta_description.252: A tasty Tuscan meatloaf with mushroom sauce.  This recipe has an unusual twist of cooking the meatloaf on the stovetop.
meta_description.253: The most foolproof way to grill the best steak? It's not complicated—it's about small details, like a picking the best cut, air-drying in the fridge, and making an herb butter sauce for basting. Fire up the grill!
meta_description.254: These Cajun-Spiced Stuffed Peppers are packed with ground beef, onion, rice, and corn, and spices! This meal is ready in the pressure cooker in a half an hour.
meta_description.255: Bacon-Wrapped Hot Dogs! These are the absolute ultimate hot dog. They're stuffed with cheese, onions, and sauerkraut, wrapped in bacon, and cooked on a hot grill. THIS is how to grill hot dogs.
meta_description.256: Enjoy the flavors of North Africa with this Moroccan Beef Pot Roast! With classic Moroccan spices -- coriander, turmeric, ginger, and cumin
meta_description.257: Grilled Flank Steak with Mushrooms is the perfect summer dinner: fast, easy, and delicious, plus it feeds the whole family. Don't skip the mushrooms! They're simmered with rosemary and red wine, and make this simple dinner feel restaurant-worthy.
meta_description.258: This comforting and classic Italian soup is made with pork and beef meatballs, greens, and tiny pasta. It's ready in about an hour from start to finish, great for a weeknight meal!
meta_description.259: Tender juicy hanger steak! Quickly sear this steak in a hot pan and then serve with a sauce of shallots and butter in a wine reduction. This makes an easy, yet impressive, home cooked meal.
meta_description.260: Quick stir-fried beef strips with sliced onions and red and green bell peppers.
meta_description.261: Chuck roast, slow cooked on low heat in a braise of barbecue sauce, then shredded and served over sandwich buns. Great for big parties.
meta_description.262: Grilled beef skewers with a spicy Korean marinade. Quick and easy Paleo dinner.
meta_description.263: These Garlic Herb Steak Bites can be whatever you want. Appetizer? Serve them with toothpicks. Dinner entrée? Serve them with rice or potatoes! Kids love 'em, too!
meta_description.264: Check out these BBQ Meatloaf Bites! Foods in miniature tend to go over well with kids, and our Eat Your Food! columnist Nick Evans found that to be true with these mini meatloaf bites baked in muffin tins. (We bet grown-ups will like them, too!)
meta_description.265: Chili, without the beans—just beef, tomatoes, onions, and lots of great spices. Make it ahead, freeze the leftovers, eat it for days.
meta_description.266: This grilled flank steak is seasoned with the smoky flavors of chili powder, paprika, and cumin. Combined with the sweetness of honey and a zip of lime juice, this flank steak is flavorful, but without covering the tender, meatiness of the cut.
meta_description.267: Skirt steak is a meat lover’s dream! This thin, quick-cooking cut is loaded with beefy flavor and stays tender and juicy after briefly searing in a hot pan. Learn how to cook skirt steak with finesse with these simple tips.
meta_description.268: You'll love this easy Slow Cooker Corned Beef and Cabbage served straight from the pot with a dollop of whole grain mustard. Leftovers make great Reuben sandwiches!
meta_description.269: Asian style hot dogs with sriracha hot sauce and Asian cole slaw.
meta_description.270: QUICK and EASY steak salad with a light miso vinaigrette. Ready in 30 minutes, or make-ahead for an even quicker weekday meal. Gluten-free.
meta_description.271: Punch up your summer grilling with these hot dogs with spicy kimchi slaw! It's an easy way to use up any kimchi in the fridge — or try it for the first time. These are a great weeknight family meal, or served to a crowd at your next cookout.
meta_description.272: Switch up your dinner routine this flank steak and citrus-avocado salsa! It's easy to make on the stovetop or on a grill, and feeds the whole family. Serve as tacos or over salad greens.
meta_description.273: Grilled, marinated tri tip steak with a salsa made with green bell peppers, garlic, and scallions. Also called sirloin tip, culotte steak, triangle steak, and Santa Maria-style barbecue.
meta_description.274: There's never a shortage of zucchini in summer, but there's often a shortage of good ways to use it. Turn your zukes into boats and stuff 'em with ground beef, queso fresco and diced peppers.
meta_description.275: Want to add a spicy kick to your burgers? These Chipotle Burgers are made by mixing smoky chipotle peppers in adobo with the ground beef! Top with jack cheese and avocado for the best burger of the summer.
meta_description.276: Butterflied flank steak that is marinated, rolled up with prosciutto, basil, Parmesan, and roasted bell peppers, and then roasted in the oven.  Great for a party.
meta_description.277: Slow Cooker Cajun-Spiced Stuffed Peppers! 15 minutes to prepare, 4 to 5 hours in the slow cooker.
meta_description.278: Ever had chicken larb?! If you're looking for a quick, super flavorful, and spicy meal, look no further than this spin on Laotian chicken larb. Use either ground chicken or turkey and serve it in sweet, buttery lettuce wraps.
meta_description.279: Classic dish of Spain and Latin America, this arroz con pollo recipe is browned chicken cooked with rice, onions, garlic, and tomatoes.
meta_description.280: Chicken paprikash with chicken pieces, browned in butter, cooked with onions and paprika, then served with a little sour cream mixed in.
meta_description.281: Chicken thighs baked in a simple honey mustard sauce until golden brown, with sprigs of rosemary.
meta_description.282: Chicken Parmesan is a classic for a reason! Chicken cutlets, breaded and fried, smothered with tomato sauce, and covered with mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses are so good. Serve with pasta or on a roll.
meta_description.283: Mango and chicken are a power combo! This mango chicken curry recipe uses boneless, skinless breasts or thighs, mango, onion, ginger, garlic, curry, cumin, raisins, and coconut milk.
meta_description.284: Here's how to make classic chicken and dumplings! Start with a hearty chicken and vegetable stew, then add delicious homemade dumplings that cook up light and fluffy.
meta_description.285: Make quick chicken soup in the pressure cooker! This classic recipe is made with whole chicken (or chicken pieces), carrots, onions, and celery, and it's ready in 60 minutes. Just add noodles for chicken noodle soup!
meta_description.286: Chinese-style sweet and sour chicken, stir-fried with bell peppers and pineapple chunks.
meta_description.287: Persian chicken stew made with chicken breasts or thighs, slowly cooked with ground toasted walnuts and pomegranate molasses.
meta_description.288: Taquitos! They're fun to say and fun to eat, they freeze well and please kids. These are filled with chicken, cheese, and seasonings, and then baked to crispy perfection.
meta_description.289: Chicken marbella recipe, classic chicken party dish, chicken cooked with white wine, prunes, green olives.  Adapted from the Silver Palate Cookbook.
meta_description.290: Quick weeknight chicken pho from expert Andrea Nguyen! Shortcut version of traditional Vietnamese noodle soup. 30-minutes. Gluten-free.
meta_description.291: This easy White Chicken Chili is like a milder, calmer cousin to Texas beef chili.  Make it with canned or dry beans, and add extra chili peppers for more heat if you like! Keeps well and freezes well.
meta_description.292: This easy lemon chicken recipe is perfect for a weeknight dinner! Not too lemony, just right. It's made with garlic, butter, lemon, thyme, and rosemary.
meta_description.293: This one-pan chicken dinner is made with potatoes, onions, garlic, cherry tomatoes, and an easy paprika sauce. Dairy-free, gluten-free. 1 hour start to finish.
meta_description.294: Easy Vietnamese-Style Noodle Bowls with Chicken are the perfect meal in a bowl. Made with vermicelli rice noodles, chicken, fresh herbs and vegetables, and a tangy rice vinegar dressing.
meta_description.295: Chicken thighs, slathered in herb vinaigrette, roasted on bed of sliced potatoes and shallots.
meta_description.296: BEST Parmesan Chicken Breast recipe ever! Chicken parts dipped in melted butter, dredged in bread crumbs and Parmesan, and baked until crisp. Delicious baked homemade chicken nuggets!
meta_description.297: Try this one-skillet pasta dinner with chicken sausage, cheese, and spinach! Takes only 30 minutes to make.
meta_description.298: One pot easy baked chicken thighs with smoked paprika, onions, and chickpeas!
meta_description.299: 1-Pot Stovetop 40 Clove Garlic Chicken! Chicken browned first in olive oil, then braised in white wine sauce with 40 cloves of garlic and thyme.
meta_description.300: This Skillet Chicken Puttanesca comes together so quickly, you'll hardly believe how good it tastes. Made with chicken breasts, canned tomatoes, olives, capers, anchovies, fresh oregano, and plenty of olive oil. Ready in 30 minutes.
meta_description.301: Basil coconut chicken curry made with chicken thighs, jalapeño, coconut milk, basil and ginger
meta_description.302: Slow Cooker Chicken Tacos are such an easy meal, either on a busy weeknight or for a party. Just throw chicken, spices, and pineapple juice (the secret ingredient!) in the slow cooker, and let it cook for hours. Leftovers freeze well for later.
meta_description.303: QUICK and EASY cheesy bruschetta chicken cutlets! Ready in 15 minutes flat. Chicken cutlets topped with canned tomatoes, garlic, mozzarella and parmesan cheese!
meta_description.304: Got fresh apricots? Make this easy Apricot Chicken skillet dinner! It's ready in under an hour and makes a great change from your usual weeknight chicken routine. (You can swap in dried apricots, too.)
meta_description.305: Our favorite red chili chicken enchiladas! Corn tortillas are dipped in red chili sauce to bake in the flavor in this easy chicken enchiladas recipe. Simple make-ahead midweek dinner. Reheats well for leftovers!
meta_description.306: Quick and easy! Chicken thighs baked with cherry tomatoes, garlic, and rosemary.
meta_description.307: One pot chicken and orzo with onions, tomato, garlic. Delicious! Quick and easy too.
meta_description.308: Skillet Roasted Chicken—a whole chicken roasted on a bed of root vegetables in a cast iron pan. Step-by-step photo directions for cooking a whole chicken. An easy one-pan roast chicken dish!
meta_description.309: This easy green curry is made with chicken, coconut milk, fresh herbs, and lime. You'll have a stunning dish to admire, smell, and taste!
meta_description.310: Boneless, skinless chicken breasts baked in tomatillo salsa verde sauce, topped with melted jack cheese. 1-pot, easy dinner!
meta_description.311: How to get juicy chicken breasts on the grill? It's all in the brine! Just 30 minutes of brining makes all the difference between dry chicken and perfect chicken.
meta_description.312: These chicken enchiladas are made with a tangy tomatillo salsa verde sauce! This is a fantastic recipe to serve a hungry crowd, whether it's Friday movie night, a pot-luck party, or just a weeknight dinner with your family.
meta_description.313: Grilled Cilantro Lime Chicken! Marinate skinless boneless chicken breasts in lime juice and cilantro marinade and then quickly grill to perfection. So easy!
meta_description.314: This chicken with creamy dijon mustard sauce is an easy and fast weeknight meal. The chicken cutlets and sauce are all cooked in the same skillet, making clean-up a breeze.
meta_description.315: This Mexican Chicken and Rice Soup takes classic chicken soup to a spicy, tomatoey new place. Serve with cilantro, lime wedges, and tortillas on the side.
meta_description.316: Chicken Fried Rice! This take-out classic is an easy weeknight meal! It's made on the stovetop with chicken, eggs, onions, carrots, peas, and rice.
meta_description.317: Chicken and cheese are made for each other in the ultimate comfort food — easy chicken mac and cheese. Top with crispy breadcrumbs for the perfect finish!
meta_description.318: Sheet pan chicken with roasted potatoes and broccoli! Everything cooks together on one baking sheet - so easy. Use chicken thighs for tender, juicy results every time.
meta_description.319: Chicken cacciatore, an Italian hunter-style chicken braised in a tomato-based sauce with onions, garlic, and white wine.
meta_description.320: Baked Chicken Marinara - chicken pieces coated with Parmesan and bread crumbs, fried and covered with a tomato basil marinara sauce, and topped with melted Mozzarella. A flavorful alternative to chicken parmesan.
meta_description.321: Slow cooker chicken and rice with onions, peas, and tomatoes—but no canned soup, please! This one's unique thanks to the combination of cumin and cinnamon.
meta_description.322: A traditional Moroccan dish of chicken pieces braised with spices, garlic, onion, olives, and preserved lemon.  Cooked in a tagine.
meta_description.323: Sheet Pan Harissa Chicken! If you're not familiar with harissa, it's a blend of chiles, spices, garlic, and olive oil. It livens up simple chicken and veggies in this sheet-pan dinner!
meta_description.324: Old fashioned, buttermilk marinated, flour coated, crispy, tender fried chicken recipe.
meta_description.325: Easy! Lemon Rosemary Chicken ~ Chicken thighs rubbed and marinated with lemon, rosemary, garlic, then seared in skillet and finished in oven.
meta_description.326: If you love take-out Sesame Chicken, then you've got to try this sous vide version. The chicken stays tender and juicy, plus there's no need to deep-fry. A quick toss with a spicy sauce brings it all together.
meta_description.327: Quick and Easy! Chicken thighs browned and baked, served with a creamy mushroom, shallot, tarragon sauce.
meta_description.328: This classic Italian Chicken Milanese is surprisingly EASY and FAST to make at home. Serve it with a side salad for an easy weeknight meal. Also works as a make-ahead dish!
meta_description.329: Give classic stroganoff a twist with some shredded rotisserie chicken! This whole dinner comes together in a jiffy, making it a new staple for busy weeknights.
meta_description.330: Spicy Chicken Stew with Tomatillos! Also jalapeños, onions, garlic, cumin, oregano, and cilantro.
meta_description.331: Pressure Cooker Chipotle Chicken and Rice Bowls! Just like fast food take-out, but better. Use the pot-in-pot method to cook the chicken and rice together in your Instant Pot or pressure cooker.
meta_description.332: Chicken browned and braised in apple cider and brandy, cooked with apple slices and onions, served with a cream sauce.
meta_description.333: A marriage of traditional chicken Florentine with pasta and basil pesto. Sliced sautéed chicken breasts with spinach, garlic, white wine, cream, pesto, and pasta.
meta_description.334: A classic spicy chicken and andouille sausage gumbo with okra.
meta_description.335: Weeknight Chicken Biryani! This stovetop version of the well-known Indian rice dish is made with chicken and seasoned with turmeric and ginger. Ready for the table in under an hour.
meta_description.336: Roast Chicken with Carrots, roasted whole chicken in an oven-proof skillet, surrounded by carrots and garlic, and stuffed with lemon and thyme.
meta_description.337: Whole chicken roast with a rub of smoked paprika, butter, garlic salt and pepper, and glazed with lemon juice and honey.
meta_description.338: Chicken Adobo with Rice in the Pressure Cooker! All-in-one recipe: the chicken and rice cook together! Use any mix of chicken pieces with onion, garlic, vinegar, soy sauce, and brown sugar. So easy!
meta_description.339: Fried chicken served with a mushroom cream sauce.  Easy to make, filling, and delicious.
meta_description.340: If you like some sweet heat, marinate your chicken thighs in this chili garlic sauce. They cook quickly on the grill and are especially good served with white rice.
meta_description.341: Ras el hanout—a Moroccan spice blend—brings deep flavors to this pressure cooker Instant Pot dish. It's made with chicken thighs, olives, lemon, garlic, onions and raisins.
meta_description.342: Grilled Chicken with South Carolina BBQ Sauce pairs zesty, mustard-based South Carolina-style barbecue sauce with grilled chicken. You get a hint of sweetness and spice from the sauce, and every bite is wonderfully smoky from the grill!
meta_description.343: Simple and quick chicken breast with apples cooked in broth, with a honey mustard sauce.
meta_description.344: The pressure cooker makes short work of shredded chicken! Season chicken thighs with some spices, set it, and let the pressure take over—you'll soon have enough shredded chicken taco meat to feed a crowd.
meta_description.345: Skinless, boneless chicken breasts with a creamy mushroom sauce with vermouth, cream, and sage.
meta_description.346: This Simple Roast Chicken is marinated in lemon juice and roasted with a honey glaze. Delicious!
meta_description.347: Chicken Bacon Roulades—chicken breasts, pounded thin, stuffed with bacon, shallots, and Parmesan, rolled up, browned, roasted, then served sliced, with a creamy white sauce.
meta_description.348: Baked Chicken Parmesan! EASY and quick, simply bread the chicken cutlets with Parmesan and crumbs, bake in the oven, and top with a fresh, homemade tomato sauce. This baked chicken parmesan is delicious. Serve with noodles.
meta_description.349: Easy and hearty chicken stew recipe with loads of red onions and tomatoes! Seasoned with Dijon mustard.
meta_description.350: Easy recipe for chicken breasts with a quick mustard cream sauce! Ready in under 30 minutes. Great with rice, pasta, or a green salad.
meta_description.351: Buffalo Chicken Lasagna! Two great dishes, together at last. Creamy blue cheese sauce and spicy chicken layered with lasagna noodles. Perfect for game day and potlucks.
meta_description.352: A quick, tasty, and filling recipe for chicken curry.
meta_description.353: Grilled chicken breast skewers, marinated in a yogurt lemon marinade, grilled with lemon slices, served with cucumber yogurt tzatziki sauce
meta_description.354: Chicken thighs with onions, browned in butter and braised in dark beer and chicken stock, for a rich, savory stew.  Chicken carbonnade.
meta_description.355: Chicken marinated in oil and vinegar with olives and raisins, then baked with wine and brown sugar. Pollo Estofado.
meta_description.356: Here's an easy chicken minestrone with basil pesto! It's easy to adapt with whatever beans, pasta, and fresh vegetables you have in the pantry. Feeds a crowd and freezes well.
meta_description.357: Need a fast meal that doesn't heat up the kitchen? These pressure cooker chicken lettuce wraps are what you need! They're also a great party appetizer — just set out a stack of lettuce leaves and let guests dig in.
meta_description.358: Chicken prosciutto! with boneless, skinless chicken breasts with butter toasted sage, wrapped in prosciutto.
meta_description.359: Broccoli, first blanched, then sautéed briefly with sliced grilled chicken, toasted almonds, sesame oil, and red chile flakes.
meta_description.360: These Teriyaki Chicken Lettuce Wraps are an easy and light weeknight meal. A quick homemade teriyaki sauce makes them way better than takeout!
meta_description.361: This Chicken Noodle Casserole is sure to hit the spot, especially if you’re looking to feed a family, satisfy that comfort food craving, or have leftovers to last the week. No canned cream of anything in this casserole. It’s from scratch and 100 percent delicious.
meta_description.362: Roast chicken, fennel, and orange come together in this makes a bright, flavorful one-pot skillet dinner. Serve it with rice, farro, quinoa or barley for an easy meal.
meta_description.363: Roasted garlic chicken recipe, whole chicken, brined in a garlic salt brine, then roasted.
meta_description.364: West African inspired chicken peanut curry, with lime, coriander seed, onion, cilantro, mint, ginger, chili, peanuts, and chicken.
meta_description.365: Skinless boneless chicken breasts marinated in yogurt with garlic, cumin, and paprika, then grilled.
meta_description.366: Slow-cooked chicken drumsticks coated in Ethiopian style berbere spice.
meta_description.367: Easy stovetop chicken stew with tomatillo sauce, potatoes, corn, and peppers. Perfect for a late-summer dinner.
meta_description.368: Whole roasted chicken, infused with fresh herbs - parsley, basil, thyme, oregano.
meta_description.369: Cornish game hens are first butterflied (spatchcocked), then grilled flattened, with the weight of a brick. Perfect for entertaining!
meta_description.370: This soba noodle soup with chicken and baby bok choy is speedy comfort food! Seasoned with ginger, lime, scallions, and herbs. A true 30-minute meal.
meta_description.371: Easiest way to dress up roast chicken? Glaze with apricot preserves!
meta_description.372: Hate dry, overcooked chicken? Sous vide is the way to go! This method makes juicy, tender chicken every time. Pair it with sous vide broccoli for easy make-ahead lunches and dinners!
meta_description.373: Roasted chicken thighs served with a sweet sour mango chutney sauce with fresh mangos, onion, garlic, vinegar, sugar, ginger, mustard seeds, and red pepper flakes.
meta_description.374: Chicken Caesar salad is such an easy, fuss-free weeknight meal. Add some smoky summertime flavor by grilling the chicken and the bread croutons!
meta_description.375: Maple-Glazed Chicken with Caramelized Onions and Pears! A one-skillet dinner you can serve right from the pan. A little mustard in the glaze gives the chicken some zing.
meta_description.376: Chicken thighs, pounded thin, marinated in mixture of orange juice, onion, garlic, herbs, and chipotle, then quickly pan fried. Delicious!
meta_description.377: Chicken cutlets and baby bok choy make a super fast and easy weeknight meal. 30 minutes, start to finish. Cooks all in one pan, so minimal clean up.
meta_description.378: Make your own homemade chicken satay, a popular Southeast Asian street food (and restaurant appetizer here in the States!), at home with a delicious marinade! Give it a quick turn on the grill and it's ready in just minutes.
meta_description.379: Make-ahead BBQ Chicken Burrito Bowl with corn, black beans, and pico de gallo. Great for lunch or dinner during busy weeks!
meta_description.380: Chicken tenders, baked with an herbed breadcrumb coating, served with simple Italian tomato dipping sauce.
meta_description.381: Chicken pieces marinated in a spicy, flavorful red chili sauce, then grilled or baked.  Pollo adobado recipe.
meta_description.382: Easy, healthy Mediterranean style chicken salad! With olive oil, vinegar, olives, capers, onions and fresh herbs.
meta_description.383: Sheet pan chicken with asparagus and potatoes to celebrate spring! Everything cooks together until tender. Really easy and only one pan to clean!
meta_description.384: Crispy curried chicken thighs! Serve with quick-sautéed onions and wilted greens. Easy 30 minute meal. Gluten-free and paleo.
meta_description.385: Ever spatchcocked a chicken? It's easier than you might think! It's the same method as butterflying a chicken, and you only need a pair of kitchen shears. Makes for more evenly cooked chicken with crispier skin!
meta_description.386: Skinless, boneless chicken breasts, pounded thin, wrapped around an arugula and goat cheese stuffing and roasted.
meta_description.387: Butterflied chicken stuffed with ricotta, Parmesan and herbs, then grilled or baked.
meta_description.388: Chicken breasts or thighs, smothered in chipotle salsa, topped with Monterey jack cheese, and baked.
meta_description.389: Homemade matzo ball soup for Passover or anytime! Fluffy matzo balls in a light, clear broth. Add chicken meat for a heartier meal.
meta_description.390: Spicy chicken drumsticks prepared with a Carribean jerk rub and then broiled.
meta_description.391: Quick and easy, sautéed zucchini noodles tossed with pesto, chicken and tomatoes.
meta_description.392: Spicy grilled chicken tacos! Quick marinade, then grill. Ready in about 30 minutes. Great for a quick weeknight dinner, backyard cookouts, and tailgate parties.
meta_description.393: Sheet pan dinners are lifesavers for busy humans, and this Sheet Pan Hawaiian Chicken is no exception. Combine chicken, peppers, and pineapple, bake, add a soy-ginger sauce, and serve. Boom! Dinner is done.
meta_description.394: Roast chicken marinated first in honey, sherry, cardamom, and pepper, then browned on the stovetop and baked to doneness in the oven.
meta_description.395: Make a beautiful golden roasted chicken with a glaze of honey and turmeric! Simple enough for a weeknight meal, but fancy enough for company.
meta_description.396: Pan-cooked boneless, skinless, chicken breasts, with mushrooms, fresh tomatoes, and port wine.
meta_description.397: These Vietnamese Sticky Chicken Skewers balance all the flavors—sweet, salty, sour, and savory! Great as a party appetizer or fun weeknight meal.
meta_description.398: Easy chicken with roasted eggplant caponata! The chicken and eggplant roast together on a sheet pan. The sweet-sour caponata comes together with tomatoes, green olives, celery, and capers. Perfect for cooler weather.
meta_description.399: Chicken thighs with spicy chermoula sauce, a North African parsley and cilantro pesto.
meta_description.400: Quick Green Curry Chicken with Zucchini Noodles! Use store-bought green curry for a fast dinner and keep it light with zucchini noodles instead of rice noodles.
meta_description.401: Lime marinated grilled chicken cutlets! With a thick and creamy black bean sauce.
meta_description.402: Try this Dukkah-Crusted Grilled Chicken! A new spice blend can really be a game changer when dinner time gets boring. Dukkah is a blend of coriander, cumin, and fennel seeds and nuts, and it pairs beautifully with grilled chicken.
meta_description.403: Marinated in rosemary, these sweet and savory grilled chicken skewers are served with a delicious blackberry sauce. How to make chicken skewers that are equally unexpected and delicious.
meta_description.404: Delicious ginger chicken! Chicken strips, marinated in coriander and ginger, stir-fried with scallions and ginger, served mixed with mango chutney and topped with toasted almonds.
meta_description.405: Hot summer weather just begs for easy, fast meals on the grill, and this Salsa Verde Chicken is exactly that. With homemade or store-bought salsa verde, they require almost zero effort but deliver big flavor.
meta_description.406: This Chicken Marsala is so creamy, and so good! Learn how to make Chicken Marsala with breaded chicken cutlets in a Marsala wine, pancetta, and cream sauce. The secret is in the pancetta!
meta_description.407: Delicious Chicken Stew! Inspired by Middle Eastern flavors with chard, coriander and cilantro.
meta_description.408: Chicken and black beans work so well together, especially piled on these easy tostadas. Top with your favorite taco fixings and drizzle with a cilantro crema. This makes a fun and easy weeknight family meal.
meta_description.409: Zesty and spicy chicken, marinated with a cashew, garlic and jalapeño sauce. Grilled or broiled to a crisp golden brown and served with lime wedges.
meta_description.410: Greek Chicken Skewers (a.k.a. Souvlaki!) served with warm flatbread and tangy yogurt sauce. A simple and healthy weeknight meal. Cook on a grill or indoors on the stovetop.
meta_description.411: This simple, satisfying salad is the perfect way to use up leftover chicken. Top it with a zingy buttermilk dressing and a wedge if garlicky toast!
meta_description.412: Quick and easy miso glazed chicken wings, perfect for game day or a fun weeknight dinner!
meta_description.413: This Sous Vide Korean BBQ Chicken is the best of both worlds: sous vide means perfectly cooked chicken; grilling means crispy skin and char-grilled flavor. So good!
meta_description.414: A great chicken curry salad recipe for potlucks or picnics. Chicken, curry powder, onion, raisins, apple, and cilantro. Mayo optional.
meta_description.415: Chicken Mango Lettuce wraps are light and nourishing, made with stir fried chicken, shiitake mushrooms, and diced mango, served in wraps of lettuce!
meta_description.416: Chicken fingers, tenders marinated in buttermilk, breaded with panko and sesame seeds, baked, served with spicy orange sauce
meta_description.417: This Easy Green Chicken Chili uses mild, roasted Hatch peppers and rotisserie chicken for a quick, delicious, kid-friendly soup. Use fresh-roasted, frozen, or jarred Hatch chiles. We love it topped with crispy tortilla chips and sliced avocado!
meta_description.418: Rich, creamy, and deeply satisfying chicken and dumplings are made even easier in the Instant Pot. The secret to a tender dumpling is using cake flour.
meta_description.419: Food on a stick is a winner for both kids and adults! Chicken and pineapple are a perfect match for the grill. Top with lemony yogurt sauce for an easy summer meal.
meta_description.420: This sped-up version of chicken korma saves time without sacrificing flavor! Boneless chicken thighs are gently simmered in a rich, creamy sauce to create layers of sweet and spicy flavors.
meta_description.421: Three Teacup Chicken is so good! A classic Chinese chicken dish with ginger, garlic, scallions, and soy sauce. Quick and easy! Takes only 20 minutes to make. One Pot.
meta_description.422: All the great fixings of chicken posole, in a salad! Chili rubbed sauteéed chicken breasts with hominy, avocado, radishes, salad greens.
meta_description.423: Whole roast chicken, stuffed with grapes and seasoned with rosemary, thyme, onions, and lemon.
meta_description.424: Orange-Ginger Chicken, spatchcocked and grilled! "Spatchcocked" is just a fancy way of saying "butterflied." It's easy and helps the chicken cook evenly. The orange-ginger marinade also makes the chicken moist and flavorful.
meta_description.425: Grilled Chicken with a Honey Mint Glaze! Such a simple way to take grilled chicken over the top.
meta_description.426: Skip take-out and make this Kung Pao Chicken at home! This spicy, sweet Chinese stir-fry is made with hot chilis, Szechwan peppercorns, garlic, ginger, and unsalted peanuts. Serve with rice for a weeknight meal.
meta_description.427: Skip the Chinese takeout and make this Cashew Chicken at home! Marinate the chicken in peanut oil, chili powder, honey, and tamari, and then cook with onions and mushrooms.
meta_description.428: Grilled sausages and mushrooms over a bowl of grains makes the perfect summer meal! Try millet for something new, or stick with rice or quinoa in your bowl.
meta_description.429: Grilled shrimp tacos with a salsa of fresh mango, avocado, red onion, jalapeño, and lime juice.
meta_description.430: Chunks of swordfish sautéed with fresh tomatoes, smoked paprika and pine nuts.
meta_description.431: Asian inspired crab cakes with fresh crab meat, lime, ginger, and sriracha.
meta_description.432: Shrimp and Artichoke Risotto! Risotto rice, clam stock, wine, artichoke hearts, and paprika seasoned shrimp.
meta_description.433: Simple and easy, grilled salmon with dill butter and lemon. Low carb and paleo too!
meta_description.434: Sheet-pan fish and chips! This is a healthier, oven-baked version of restaurant fish and chips. Use any white fish. Ready in an hour.
meta_description.435: Looking for a mussels recipe with Wow factor? This is it. Fresh mussels cooked in and served with a spicy coconut curry broth.
meta_description.436: Finally! This Grilled Cheese BLT means you'll never have to choose between two delicious sandwiches for your lunch ever again. Have them both! Right now!
meta_description.437: Spicy ground pork with mango, almonds, and cilantro. Perfect over rice!
meta_description.438: A Hawaiian-inspired pork burger with ground ginger and green onion in the patty, topped with barbecue sauce, grilled pineapple and ham.
