meta_description.439: Pumpkin Chili! Made with chunks of pumpkin, ground pork, black beans, a bottle of beer, and plenty of spices. Ready in under an hour. Even better the next day.
meta_description.440: Bacon-wrapped pork roast! Wrapping the pork roast in bacon brings extra juiciness and flavor to the roast.
meta_description.441: Nervous about overcooking pork chops? Try sous vide! Cooking pork chops sous vide keeps them moist and tender, and finishing them on the grill brings on the char and flavor!
meta_description.442: Stuff these shells with mint and ricotta, then bake them with Italian sausage and tomato sauce. They're amazing! These stuffed shells are perfect for a family meal or a potluck.
meta_description.443: Angel hair pasta, also called capellini, served with shrimp and a lemon cream sauce with herbs and parmesan.
meta_description.444: Pasta with a tomato sauce with Italian turkey sausage and smoked mozzarella cheese.
meta_description.445: A simple dish of pasta shells with a buttery tomato sauce, tuna and ricotta, all baked with a cheesy parmesan crust.
meta_description.446: Easy 30-minute Shrimp Pasta with creamy tomato vodka sauce, so rich and delicious!
meta_description.447: Creamy Ziti Florentine is a good weeknight recipe to have in your back pocket. Made with spinach, green onions, lemon, and ricotta cheese. Quick and easy stove-top recipe!
meta_description.448: Fettuccine Alfredo two ways: with cream and nutmeg, or with butter and Parmesan! Try it both ways and decide which one you like the best!
meta_description.449: The BEST Lasagna Bolognese! Layers of flat lasagna noodles baked with alternating layers of slow-cooked Bolognese sauce, bechamel, and Parmesan cheese.
meta_description.450: Quick and easy spaghetti recipe with Italian sausage. The tomato-based sauce gets its seasoning from the sweet and spicy sausages. Our favorite way to make spaghetti!
meta_description.451: Take advantage of salmon season and make this Angel Hair Pasta with Salmon, Arugula with Creamy Lemon-Parmesan Sauce. You can have this satisfying dinner on the table in a half an hour.
meta_description.452: Spaghetti with Tomatoes, Bacon, and Eggs—the ultimate comfort food! Ready in the time it takes to cook the spaghetti. Such a perfect combination, so easy for a weeknight dinner.
meta_description.453: Quick and easy! Tuna pasta with canned tuna, tomato, red onion, kalamata olives, lemon, capers, and Mozzarella cheese
meta_description.454: This classic Italian sauce simmers for hours to develop maximum flavor. Made with a blend of ground beef, pork, and Italian sausage, it's great with fresh tagliatelle or fettuccine, pappardelle, or other pasta.
meta_description.455: Pasta Puttanesca is a classic Italian pasta dish that's ready in under 40 minutes! Make it with canned tomato paste and crushed tomatoes, canned anchovies, jarred olives and capers. So simple and so good.
meta_description.456: Fall apart tender and smoky, barbecued pork shoulder, cooked low and slow on a 2-burner gas grill.
meta_description.457: This Sausage, Pepper, and Potato Bake is a crowd-pleasing and budget-friendly meal that still feels indulgent. Look for kielbasa on sale and round it out with peppers, potatoes, and onions. Don't skip the sauce - it's what makes the whole dish!
meta_description.458: Skip the jarred BBQ sauce! This pulled pork comes together easily and the homemade marinade makes the difference. Slowly cooked pork shoulder becomes fall-off-the-bone tender.
meta_description.459: When you need pulled pork fast, make it in the Instant Pot or pressure cooker! In about half the time of other recipes, this recipe makes the oh-so-tender carnitas for tacos, burritos, enchiladas, and many other Mexican dishes.
meta_description.460: Ham balls! Made from ham, bacon and ground pork, glazed with pineapple juice, brown sugar, cider vinegar, ketchup and dry mustard.
meta_description.461: Hearty fall stew with pork shoulder, roasted poblano chiles, chipotle, onions, sweet potatoes, and corn.
meta_description.462: Great use for leftover ham! Quick and easy, ham and peas with pasta, cream, and Parmesan.
meta_description.463: A hearty black bean and mixed meat stew that is often called the national dish of Brazil.
meta_description.464: Pan-fried pork chops with a creamy Dijon mustard sauce.
meta_description.465: Crown rib roast of pork with an apple and Italian sausage stuffing.
meta_description.466: Easy Slow Cooker Chinese Pulled Pork! With spices, honey, ginger, soy sauce. Just put it in the crockpot and go!
meta_description.467: Creamy, cheesy Ham and Cheese Pasta Bake - with parmesan, mozzarella, and ham. This cheesy pasta is comfort food at it's best and a delicious weeknight meal.
meta_description.468: Perfect glazed ham for the holidays! Spiral cut ham with cranberry, orange, mustard glaze.
meta_description.469: Pork Schnitzel! An authentic schnitzel - thinly pounded breaded pork cutlets, browned and served with a creamy dill sauce.
meta_description.470: Hearty pork and black bean stew with pork shoulder, onions, red bell peppers, jalapeños, garlic, cornmeal, black beans, spices, molasses, and a splash of lime juice. Perfect for a cold day!
meta_description.471: Pot Sticker Stir-Fry from Michelle Tam's new Nom Nom Paleo book "Ready or Not!" It's like eating pot stickers, but without the wrapper. Made with carrots, mushrooms, ginger, pork, and Napa cabbage.
meta_description.472: Pork chops, seared first, then oven baked with a maple syrup gravy.
meta_description.473: Pan-seared pork chops with a quick pomegranate juice glaze. Top with pomegranate seeds and parsley. 30 minutes to make.
meta_description.474: This slow cooker cider pulled pork feeds a crowd and warms the belly. Make it for a large party and let guests serve themselves, or make it for a family dinner and look forward to leftovers all week long!
meta_description.475: Easy grilled pork tenderloin, marinated in soy sauce, ginger, sesame oil marinade, and grilled to perfection!
meta_description.476: Seared cabbage and onions that are then braised with caraway, celery seed, mustard and a little stock or water.
meta_description.477: Slow-cooked pork shoulder with a savory gravy made with roasted apples and onions.
meta_description.478: Grilled pork tenderloin topped with a tasty orange marmalade glaze.
meta_description.479: Sausage Rolls are a must-have for potlucks, Game Day parties, and holiday gatherings. Made with pizza dough and fresh sausages, they're like grown-up pigs in a blanket!
meta_description.480: Pork tenderloin, marinated in buttermilk, breaded with panko and baked. Served with Dijon mustard cream sauce.
meta_description.481: An easy, tender, succulent pork tenderloin recipe with sliced apples.
meta_description.482: Pan-fried pork chops on the stovetop are so quick and easy! Use a homemade dry rub to really bring out the flavor of the chops.
meta_description.483: Danish frikadeller pork burgers recipe. Ground pork mixed with eggs, crumbled saltine crakers and onions, shaped into patties and fried. Serve with Dijon mustard.
meta_description.484: Hungarian stuffed cabbage rolls are hearty comfort food at its best! Cabbage leaves are stuffed with ground pork, onions, garlic, egg, rice, and spices, and braised in a tomato sauce.
meta_description.485: Ground pork formed into meatballs with minced bacon, garlic, eggs, bread crumbs, and oregano, cooked with a chipotle chili and tomato sauce.
meta_description.486: White cannellini beans with Italian sausage in a plum tomato sauce.
meta_description.487: This Pork Stir Fry is such an easy weeknight meal. Made with just lean pork, some green onions, and garlic, and ready in 25 minutes start to finish. Skip the take-out and make your own!
meta_description.488: Lentils cooked in a rich broth made from leftover ham and served with slices of that same leftover ham.
meta_description.489: A classic Italian comfort food of rice with peas and chunks of ham.
meta_description.490: Grilled sweet Italian sausages, bell peppers and red onions, with a honey balsamic glaze, served over a bed of baby arugula
meta_description.491: Italian meatballs with ground pork shoulder, Italian sausage, bread, ricotta cheese, eggs, and herbs, in a simple tomato sauce with basil and Parmesan.
meta_description.492: Puerto Rican Arroz con Tocino is such an easy weeknight meal. It's made with rice and salt pork (or bacon!) and topped with a fried egg. You can also eat this for breakfast!
meta_description.493: Pork chops cooked low and slow become so tender and juicy—and so do the cabbage and apples that cook with them. Serve with a cold beer and imagine yourself at a biergarten in Germany.
meta_description.494: Grilled pork tenderloin dry rubbed with herbes de Provence and served with grilled peaches.
meta_description.495: Honey-mustard glazed pork chops with roasted sweet potatoes and Brussels sprouts. The perfect fall dinner. Everything roasts together on one sheet pan.
meta_description.496: Pork tenderloin, marinated in orange juice, lemon juice, garlic, shallots, and chipotle chiles, then oven roasted.
meta_description.497: Marinated Pork Tenderloin with Figs and Olives is a classic Mediterranean dish. It's tangy, sweet, and savory, and filled with flavor! Easy to make, elegant presentation.
meta_description.498: Brined pork loin, roasted with an onion cardamom crust and served with a mushroom cream sauce.
meta_description.499: Have a few extra-large zucchinis? Stuff them with Italian sausage, onions, garlic, tomato, and fresh breadcrumbs, and bake!
meta_description.500: Is there no better combo than pork chops with Kielbasa sausage and sauerkraut? Classic hearty German pork chops recipe.
meta_description.501: Delicious pork spare ribs slow cooked with cabbage and sauerkraut, and braised in beer.
meta_description.502: Pork chops, brined overnight in a salt sugar solution, seared and served with parsley lemon garlic gremolata
meta_description.503: It's all about the citrus brine with these pork chops! Brining helps them stay tender and moist through the high heat of grilling, and the citrus adds a magical zing to the flavor!
meta_description.504: Pork tenderloin medallions, sauteed in butter and served with a caper mustard cream sauce.
meta_description.505: Pork spareribs cooked with sauerkraut, onions, white wine, and juniper berries. Classic German recipe!
meta_description.506: Italian sausages cooked in the oven with ratatouille, sauteed zucchini, bell pepper, tomatoes, onion, garlic, and eggplant.
meta_description.507: Pan-seared pork chops with a sweet and sour pear and ginger sauce. Perfect for the fall, cooks up in minutes and only uses one pot!
meta_description.508: Breaded pork chops served with an unforgettable mushroom bourbon cream sauce!
meta_description.509: Slow Cooker Sausage Balls are cheesy, easy to make, and super delicious. Serve them as a party appetizer, spoon over pasta, or make a meatball sub! You choose.
meta_description.510: These pan-seared pork chops with a side of garlicky greens are the perfect one-pan meal. It's ready in about half an hour, too! P.S. Brining makes all the difference with  making juicy chops, so don't skip it.
meta_description.511: The secret to amazing ribs? A pressure cooker, of course! The results of these Instant Pot BBQ Baby Back Ribs are fall-off-the-bone perfection and take a fraction of the time.
meta_description.512: Sheet pan dinners are lifesavers, and this recipe for Sheet Pan Ranch Pork Chops comes with a bonus: the seasoning mix is also great for homemade dressing or flavoring other meals!
meta_description.513: Creamy tomato soup is elevated by adding cheese-filled tortellini, Italian sausage, and fresh spinach. A touch of cream and a handful of fresh basil make this easy weeknight meal a fan favorite!
meta_description.514: You can make this Easy Pork Fried Rice any time of the year thanks to frozen vegetables. Add them straight from the freezer to your skillet. Want to use frozen rice? That makes dinner even easier!
meta_description.515: Grilled pork chops with a fresh, Italian-style cherry salsa made with onions, basil and balsamic vinegar.
meta_description.516: Cheesy Polenta with Grilled Sausages and Veggies! The oven makes polenta EASY. Great for a weeknight summer meal.
meta_description.517: Sesame-Crusted Pork Cutlets with Crispy Shallots! Fast, easy midweek meal. Serve with a quick spinach salad.
meta_description.518: Quick and easy pork chops with a sweet and sour sauce made with red currant jelly and Dijon mustard. 25 minutes start to finish!
meta_description.519: Pork tenderloin, seared in butter, then roasted, served with caramelized onions and sauteed fresh figs.
meta_description.520: These baked scallops are so easy and delicious! First, simmer them with a little wine, and then briefly bake them with a creamy sauce.
meta_description.521: These easy Shrimp Cakes are such a good weeknight meal. They're made with shrimp and sweet potatoes mixed with garlic and other spices. Serve with tartar sauce and coleslaw!
meta_description.522: Crab cakes with Dungeness crab are a treat! They can be a little delicate, so a chill in the fridge before frying helps them from falling apart while frying.
meta_description.523: Cod fillets cooked in onions, green olives, tomatoes and orange slices.
meta_description.524: Pacific petrale sole fillets, quickly sauteed and served with a sauce of white wine, shallots, butter, and herbs.
meta_description.525: Grilled swordfish steaks that have marinated in olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, thyme and garlic
meta_description.526: Throwing a fancy party? Broiled Lobster Tail should definitely be on the menu. This step-by-step guide will show you exactly what to do. Serve with an easy brown butter and toasted hazelnut sauce!
meta_description.527: Pan seared salmon with a creamy avocado remoulade sauce, avocados puréed with lime juice, olive oil, shallots, parsley, and Dijon.
meta_description.528: Large sea scallops, seared and topped with brown butter sauce with capers and lemon zest.
meta_description.529: This easy noodle stir-fry comes together in just over ten minutes! Leave the take-out menu in the drawer and make this one at home.
meta_description.530: Oven Roasted Salmon, Asparagus & New Potatoes are quick, EASY, and delicious! Make everything in one sheet pan, easy clean-up, perfect for a midweek dinner
meta_description.531: Quick, easy, healthy! Salmon fillets poached in a tomato onion caper sauce with white wine.
meta_description.532: This easy flounder with Parmesan breadcrumbs is the perfect vacation dinner. It's quick to make with shredded Parmesan Cheese & there's plenty for everyone. Cheesy breadcrumbs FTW!
meta_description.533: Baked salmon provencal recipe with a sauce of fresh tomatoes, fresh chopped herbs, a few shallots, lemon juice, balsamic and olive oil.
meta_description.534: Zucchini noodles with shrimp! Toss with lemon-garlic butter for a quick, easy dinner. Ready in 30 minutes.
meta_description.535: Sake ginger glazed salmon recipe, marinated in a Japanese yakitori sauce and fresh ginger.
meta_description.536: One of our favorite tilapia recipes! This quick and easy one-pan meal is cooks the tilapia with onions, garlic, diced tomatoes, mushrooms, and olives.
meta_description.537: Skillet Shrimp and Asparagus, only use one pan! Quick, easy, and delicious, perfect for a midweek meal.
meta_description.538: Spicy crab cakes recipe with fresh Dungeness crabmeat, parsley, bread crumbs, egg, lemon jice, Tabasco, Wocestershire sauce, Dijon, paprika, thyme, onion, and bell pepper.  Serve with a horseradish mayo.
meta_description.539: Making chicken lo mein at home means you can clear the fridge of whatever veggies you've got on hand, and have dinner ready faster than it would take to call for takeout. Win!
meta_description.540: Perfect Beef Wellington! Beef tenderloin fillet, coated with mustard, mushroom duxelles, ham, wrapped in puff pastry and baked. Based on Gordon Ramsay Beef Wellington recipe.
meta_description.541: This small-batch weeknight lasagna comfortably serves two and is ready in half the time as a larger batch. Loaf Pan Lasagna is layered with chunky pieces of sausage and rustic-but-quick tomato sauce.
meta_description.542: Irish stew recipe made with beef, garlic, stock, Irish Guinness beer, red wine, potatoes, carrots, and onions. An excellent, hearty stew.
meta_description.543: Want the most perfectly moist, flavorful, and juicy Thanksgiving turkey? Try dry-brining! All you do is rub the turkey with salt and let it hang out in the fridge for 24 to 72 hours. No muss, no fuss. The best turkey you'll ever eat will soon be yours!
meta_description.544: Roast Beef Tenderloin, seared then oven roasted, served with mushrooms sautéed in the pan drippings with butter and herbs.
meta_description.545: Cheesy Potato Casserole without the canned cream of anything soup. This recipe relies on simple ingredients in your pantry to make a quick and easy cheese sauce. It sounds fancy, but don’t worry. It’s easy!
meta_description.546: Here's the BEST Corned Beef and Cabbage for your St. Patrick's Day Party! We give you 2-ways to make it—boiled in spiced water the traditional way or baked with cloves and sweet hot honey mustard. Either way is delicious.
meta_description.547: Baked Ziti - classic Italian American comfort food of pasta baked with sausage, tomato sauce and all kinds of gooey, yummy cheeses. So EASY and so good!
meta_description.548: Classic roast beef recipe using rump roast, round roast, or sirloin tip. This slow roasting method at low heat is good for tougher cuts of beef; the lower heat prevents any gristle from getting too tough.
meta_description.549: Glazed Baked Ham is so easy and delicious! Choose from two different glazes, both with honey. Baked ham is a great way to feed a crowd during the holidays.
meta_description.550: American favorite shepherd's pie recipe, casserole with ground beef, vegetables such as carrots, corn, and peas, topped with mashed potatoes.
meta_description.551: This classic lasagna is made with an easy meat sauce as the base. Layer the sauce with noodles and cheese, then bake until bubbly! This is great for feeding a big family, and freezes well, too.
meta_description.552: Classic homemade pizza recipe, including pizza dough and toppings, step-by-step instructions with photos.  Make perfect pizza at home!
meta_description.553: Rack of Lamb is so elegant! Perfect for entertaining. Tender oven-roasted rack of lamb, seasoned with rosemary, thyme, garlic, salt and freshly ground black pepper, and slathered with olive oil.
meta_description.554: This Lemon Pesto Turkey Pasta is an easy way to use up leftover holiday turkey! With bowtie pasta, basil pesto and lemon zest, carbonara style
meta_description.555: Irish lamb stew recipe made with lamb shoulder chops, bacon, potatoes, turnip, carrots, onion and barley.  Slow cooked until fork tender.
meta_description.556: Who wants tacos?! These slow cooker chipotle chicken tacos are perfect for Game Day parties and weeknight dinners.
meta_description.557: Duck breast seasoned with rosemary and served with a sweet sour apricot sauce.
meta_description.558: Salmon fillets, baked in foil over a bed of julienned red bell peppers and leeks. Gluten-free, paleo, and low-carb!
meta_description.559: Easy cheesy quinoa bake with black beans, corn, garlic, shredded cooked turkey, and lots of cheddar cheese!
meta_description.560: Classic French preparation of rabbit, braised in white wine with shallots and prunes.
meta_description.561: These shrimp taco bowls are the best kind of summer meal: fast, fresh, and won't heat up the kitchen. The shrimp are deeply seasoned with paprika and cumin, then grilled and served in bowls with taco fixings and a spicy cilantro dressing.
meta_description.562: Hearty fall and winter soup with pumpkin, white beans, a ham hock, tomato, and chard.
meta_description.563: Turkey stew with chunks of turkey, onions, garlic, bell peppers, and mushrooms in a smooth but tangy yogurt-tomato base.
meta_description.564: Cod poached in water infused with bay leaves, garlic, salt, and olive oil.
meta_description.565: Seared lamb loin chops, served with chimichurri sauce of mint and parsley.
meta_description.566: Roasted turkey breast with a rich gravy made with roasted garlic and pan drippings.
meta_description.567: Quick and easy, salmon fillets, nestled on a bed of fennel, dotted with lemon and butter, baked in a pouch of parchment paper.
meta_description.568: Try this Quick Sausage, Kale, and Crouton Sauté from Deb Perelman's new cookbook, Smitten Kitchen Every Day! It's a fast meal that's easy to adapt and is always a hit at dinner time.
meta_description.569: Ground turkey meatballs made with herbs and sour cream, tossed with fresh tomatoes and basil.
meta_description.570: Ever slow-roast salmon? So good! Tender and silky. We do this one with a glaze of sweet chili sauce and scallions. Easy dinner party recipe.
meta_description.571: Grilled lamb burgers with homemade tzatziki cucumber sauce! Top with feta, sliced tomato, lettuce, and red onion. Easy summer cook-out recipe.
meta_description.572: Leftover turkey casserole with bacon, onions, mushrooms, mashed sweet potatoes, Gruyere cheese, and a buttery cracker topping
meta_description.573: Oven-baked salmon fillets served with avocado, mango, chile, lime salsa.
meta_description.574: Love fish tacos? Love salad? Then you'll love these easy Fish Taco Salad Bowls! They're healthy with quickly-seared white fish and plenty of fresh vegetables. Serve with tortilla chips alongside or over top for extra crunch!
meta_description.575: Mushroom risotto with Parmesan cheese, mushrooms, and sweet Italian sausage.
meta_description.576: Tuna burgers to the rescue when you need dinner in a hurry and you're drawing a blank! Grab a can of tuna from the cupboard and you're mostly done. Some dill olive mayo takes it over the top!
meta_description.577: Here's a classic recipe for Camarones al Ajillo, a.k.a. spicy garlic shrimp! The shrimp gets quickly sautéed with garlic and jalapeno, then mixed with some coconut rice. Serve with coconut rice for a full meal.
meta_description.578: Fish cakes made with fresh-cooked salmon! So incredibly tender and flavorful, especially with spicy mayo sauce! Great way to use up leftover salmon, too.
meta_description.579: Turkey tacos recipe with cranberry salsa! Another great way to use up Thanksgiving turkey leftovers.
meta_description.580: Hot dog frankfurters cooked with sauerkraut in a onion, paprika, sour cream sauce.
meta_description.581: Foil packs on the grill are so easy! Just toss together veggies and some sausage, and close them up in foil before tossing on the grill. It's a mostly hands-off process that brings together the best flavors of summer.
meta_description.582: A peach-avocado salsa is a delicious complement to this grilled salmon. A grill pan ensures the salmon stays crispy throughout the cooking process without sticking to the grill. Winner!
meta_description.583: Delicious Turkey Stew! Made with flavorful turkey legs, browned and braised, served with root vegetables.
meta_description.584: From its dramatic puffy rise to its whole grain flavor, this Dutch baby pancake is a winner. Top it with smoked salmon and fried eggs and serve it for brunch — or for dinner!
meta_description.585: Craving lamb curry? Make this recipe on the stovetop or in the pressure cooker. Whatever you choose, slowly cooking the lamb is the key to tender lamb in this dish. Make a pot of rice and dinner is served.
meta_description.586: A favorite dish for Chinese New Year, shrimp stir-fried in a sauce of ketchup, rice vinegar, sesame oil, sugar, and broth, and served on a bed of lettuce.
meta_description.587: Italian sausage casserole with polenta, Italian sausage, tomato sauce, and Mozzarella cheese.
meta_description.588: Simple and easy cheese tacos recipe, made with corn tortillas, fried in a little butter, folded over grated cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese.  Also known as quesadillas.
meta_description.589: Get your grill on with tuna kabobs! skewers of marinated fresh tuna, onions, bell peppers, and mushrooms.
meta_description.590: You don't need to be in Cape Cod in order to make this clambake. Just follow these instructions for a one-pot clambake, New England style, in the comfort of your own home.
meta_description.591: Easy baked tilapia fillets with sun-dried tomato, Parmesan, breadcrumb crust, and optional berry sauce.
meta_description.592: Craving Hot and Sour Soup just like your favorite Chinese restaurant? This recipe will hit the spot! It's made with Chinese mushrooms, bamboo shoots, tofu, and a beaten egg.
meta_description.593: Rich and hearty lamb shank and butternut squash stew, served with parsley, garlic, and lemon gremolata.
meta_description.594: How to make a turkey burger juicy? With grated zucchini! This turkey zucchini burger has basil, onions, and garlic, served with garlic mayo
meta_description.595: Large zucchini stuffed with ground turkey, mushrooms, tomatoes, basil, rosemary, and Parmesan cheese.
meta_description.596: Grilled Fish Tacos topped with a sweet and tangy Strawberry Pineapple Salsa! This is the perfect summer meal: light, fresh, and fast. Great for a party.
meta_description.597: Foolproof salmon in the slow cooker? Yes, please! This method of poaching the salmon in a flavorful broth using the slow cooker guarantees success.
meta_description.598: This halibut is baked nestled in a bed of fennel, peppers, tomatoes, olives and fresh herbs. It's a one skillet supper that's ready in a flash!
meta_description.599: Make these sweet potato waffles with fried egg, bacon, and scallions for breakfast, lunch, or dinner! Great way to use up leftover sweet potatoes.
meta_description.600: One-pan roasted salmon, rubbed with Moroccan harissa spice, roasted with green beans, bell peppers, and cherry tomatoes. Easy and elegant!
meta_description.601: How to grill whole trout, stuffed with lemon, dill, and dotted with butter. Easy!
meta_description.602: Grilled shrimp with an Italian tomato salsa of fresh, uncooked tomatoes, black olives, garlic and parsley.
meta_description.603: Easy and delicious casserole with baked kohlrabi, ham, eggs, and cream.
meta_description.604: Sautéed shrimp topped with a mango pineapple kiwi salsa and toasted coconut flakes. 1 pot and takes only 25 minutes to make!
meta_description.605: Taco Salad made with healthy ground turkey, black beans, and corn. Serve warm or cold over romaine lettuce with fresh tomatoes, avocados, and shredded cheese. Perfect for a mid-week meal or make-ahead lunch.
meta_description.606: A perfect casserole for apple season! Tart green apples baked with sweet Italian sausage in a pie crust, topped with Italian cheeses.
meta_description.607: Looking for a delicious and filling dinner for two? Then try this stuffed squash recipe loaded with ground turkey, wild rice, apples, and herbs.
meta_description.608: This one-pan dinner is ready in a flash! Broccoli takes on a sweetness in the oven, and the salmon, topped with miso butter, becomes flavorful and moist. This one is sure to become a favorite!
meta_description.609: A classic German pot roast: Venison or beef marinated and then braised in a rich sauce that's finished with crushed ginger snaps.
meta_description.610: Chiles en Nogada, poblano chiles stuffed with a ground turkey picadillo, covered in a creamy walnut sauce and sprinkled with pomegranate seeds.  From Puebla, Mexico.
meta_description.611: Chile verde made with turkey thigh meat and homemade tomatillo salsa verde.
meta_description.612: Grilled Polish Sausage and Sauerkraut! Here's how to cook Polish sausage with sauerkraut and onions, simmered in beer, and spiced with caraway seeds. A summer BBQ staple!
meta_description.613: Pacific black cod (sable fish) cooked in a broth of sake, rice vinegar, soy sauce and oil, delicious!
meta_description.614: Turkey noodle casserole with egg noodles, leftover turkey, shallots, celery, and a white sauce with Gruyere, mustard, and tarragon.
meta_description.615: This meat and cheese-stuffed stromboli will feed a crowd! Homemade stromboli with ham, salami, provolone, and mozzarella rolled up in pizza dough. Easy to make, easy to share.
meta_description.616: Creamy cheesy turkey enchiladas! Leftover turkey, sweet potatoes, cream cheese rolled into flour tortillas, smothered with creamy salsa verde sauce. So good!
meta_description.617: Perfect for a hearty meal! Lamb shanks braised with onions, garlic, carrots, celery, potatoes, raisins and mint, and seasoned with oregano, thyme, and rosemary.
meta_description.618: Ever had a Croque-Madame? This is a classic French ham and grilled cheese sandwich, topped with a fried egg! Great for an easy lunch or dinner.
meta_description.619: Rabbit, seared and braised with onions, celery root, and Belgian ale.
meta_description.620: Quick, easy, delicious salmon dinner! Salmon fillets marinated in a mixture of miso, sake, and soy sauce, then cooked under the broiler.
meta_description.621: Turkey enchiladas made with leftover cooked turkey, homemade chili sauce, onions, black beans, and Monterey jack cheese. Topped with red onions, avocado, and cilantro.
meta_description.622: This luxuriously smooth and flavorful ratatouille recipe is well worth the effort. Vegetables are first browned, then roasted, then cooked in a tomato sauce.  This ratatouille dish includes onion, garlic, zucchini, squash, bell peppers, eggplant, tomatoes, and fresh herbs.
meta_description.623: BLT Salad for dinner tonight! Make with ripe tomatoes, crispy bacon, green beans, and sweet corn.
meta_description.624: Turkey breast, butterflied, rolled with prosciutto, chard, pine nut stuffing, and roasted. Perfect for holiday meal!
meta_description.625: Baked spaghetti squash tossed with sautéed onions, kale, sausage, and Parmesan cheese.
meta_description.626: Spicy lamb stew, lamb shoulder slow cooked in white wine with onions, garlic, bell peppers, pasilla chiles, paprika, cumin, tomatoes, raisins, and herbs.
meta_description.627: Cilantro lime shrimp! Simple sautéed shrimp with garlic, cilantro, green chile and lime.
meta_description.628: Simple roast quail, roasted quickly on high heat and served with a balsamic vinegar reduction.
meta_description.629: Quick and easy broiled salmon fillets with a hoisin sauce glaze.
meta_description.630: This simple shrimp risotto was inspired by a trip to Venice. It's made with tiny pink shrimp, shallots, parsley, and lemon zest. Super creamy! You'll think you're in Italy!
meta_description.631: This easy slow cooker meatball recipe uses a blend of beef and Italian turkey sausage for a lightened-up version that still makes a flavorful, juicy meatball. Perfect for a weeknight dinner served over pasta or with toothpicks at tailgating party!
meta_description.632: Homemade flour tortillas are easy to make in the comfort of your own kitchen. All it takes four simple ingredients (one is water) and about 1 hour – that includes a 30-minute rest time! No special equipment needed.
meta_description.633: Check out this creamy, saucy pasta with tender salmon and vibrant peas! It's easy to throw together on a weeknight, packed with protein, and sure to become a new family favorite.
meta_description.634: These LOADED baked potatoes turn a standard side dish into a full-on entrée. Packed with steamed broccoli, bacon, cheddar, sour cream, and chives, they are a meal on their own! They are quick to toss together, have a variety of different flavors and ingredients, and are economical to make in bulk.
meta_description.635: For this Miso Fish Soup, white fish fillets are gently simmered in a savory broth then topped with green vegetables, herbs, and soba noodles. Ladle up a bowl of this satisfying soup and enjoy healthy comfort food at its finest.
meta_description.636: Salmon under the broiler makes for a quick and easy weeknight meal. Just mix the jerk seasoning together and slather it on the salmon for a spicy kick. A few minutes later, you’ll have a satisfying, healthy dinner bursting with flavor.
meta_description.637: Fish tacos are made for hot summer days! Crispy, spicy fish tucked into a bed of crunchy, sweet, and sour red cabbage slaw, all piled high on a tortilla—just add ice cold drinks and lots of laughter for a party. Taco Tuesday never tasted so good!
meta_description.638: Hello, homemade Panko Fish Sticks! Say goodbye to soggy fish sticks from the freezer! These fish sticks are ready for the table in about 30 minutes and are sure to please the whole family.
meta_description.639: It's all in the seasoning for these skillet shrimp fajitas! Toss shrimp in some chili powder and red pepper flakes, and then quickly cook them in a skillet with some veggies. Better-than-restaurant quality fajitas are yours in no time!
meta_description.640: Ham, broccoli, and cheese take center stage in this crustless quiche! It's low-carb, gluten-free, and full of rich creamy goodness!
meta_description.641: What about BBQ chicken for your next pizza?! This recipe uses leftover cooked chicken and balances sweetness with heat with a hickory BBQ sauce. Press the dough into the pan, add the toppings, and you're good to go!
meta_description.642: This Homemade Pepperoni Pizza has everything you want—a great crust, gooey cheese, and tons of pepperoni. The secret to great pepperoni flavor? Hide extra under the cheese! Who needs delivery?
meta_description.643: Instant Pot French Onion Soup! French onion soup is comfort food at its finest. Rich, intensely-flavored broth and caramelized onions, topped with crusty, cheese-covered bread is sure to warm anyone on a cold winter’s night. Make this delicious soup in half the time by using your Instant Pot!
meta_description.644: These Classic Southern Buttermilk Biscuits are light, tender, and the perfect match for a slice of ham, melted butter and honey, your favorite jam, or smothered in country gravy!
meta_description.645: Pan seared scallops nestled in a bed of sweet corn and poblano chiles—perfect for sultry summer nights. Invite some friends over, pour a glass of crisp white wine, and watch the fireflies.
meta_description.646: This hearty, filing Puerto Rican stew is full of pigeon peas, shrimp, and rice. It's satisfying soul food for cold days—or any day you need some TLC. Soaking the rice ahead of time speeds up the cooking.
meta_description.647: Make leftover fish sing with these fish cakes seasoned with fresh herbs, capers, mustard, and scallions. Don't skip the tarragon mayo -- it's the perfect sauce for these cakes. Leftovers never looked so good!
meta_description.648: Sushi-grade tuna steaks, pan seared, served with slices of avocado and a ginger, soy, cilantro, lime, garlic sauce.
meta_description.649: Panko-crusted baked salmon! Salmon steaks or fillets coated in honey mustard, breaded with Japanese panko crumbs, and baked to perfection.
meta_description.650: Rich, creamy mushroom risotto with risotto rice, brandy, Parmesan and mushrooms.
meta_description.651: Bacon-wrapped pork tenderloin stuffed with apples, onions, and herbs! Fancy enough for a dinner party, but easy to make. Ready in under 60 minutes.
meta_description.652: Best seafood stew EVER! San Francisco-style Cioppino with halibut, sea bass, Dungeness crab, shrimp, and mussels.
meta_description.653: We LOVE this pork loin roast stuffed with chopped apples, walnuts and cranberries. So festive, perfect for holiday entertaining!
meta_description.654: Break out your skillet tonight for this Italian-inspired chicken dish! Spinach, tomatoes, red onion, and capers combine to make this super simple meal a flavor superstar. Freezes well, too!
meta_description.655: Warning: This Char Siu Chicken is highly addictive! You'll wonder how you ever grilled chicken thighs without this mix of honey, hoisin, garlic, soy sauce, and Chinese five-spice powder. It's a take-out staple that's easy to make at home!
meta_description.656: Italian Grilled Cheese Sandwiches! Italian sub, meet your friend, grilled cheese!  This is a gooey match made in heaven: three kinds of Italian deli meat, provolone, and buttery toasted bread.
meta_description.657: Twice Baked Sweet Potatoes with Southwestern toppings are the BEST! Black beans, corn, bell peppers, and creamy queso fresco make this a colorful and filling main dish all on its own. Score!
meta_description.658: Butter Chicken simmers in a buttery tomato sauce and is punctuated by several special spices and herbs. Skip the Indian takeout and cook up your very own version of the popular dish!
meta_description.659: Need a good make-ahead meal? These Quinoa Bowls are loaded with creamy black beans, vitamin packed sweet potatoes, wilted spinach, and crunchy pepitas! Make everything on a Sunday and you have work-day lunches ready for the week!
meta_description.660: Puerto Rican Salmorejo de Jueyes is a treat for anyone who loves crab! Traditionally an all-day family affair, buying lump crab meat means you can have this hearty stew and rice on the table in about a half an hour.
meta_description.661: Yes! Fried chicken in the air fryer is totally possible! It's crispy, juicy, and delicious. If you're craving a fried chicken with a little less fat, give this a try!
meta_description.662: BBQ Chicken cooked slowly on the grill, slathered with your favorite barbecue sauce - does it get any better? This is the best recipe for making perfect BBQ chicken for all your summer gatherings and cook outs.
meta_description.663: Quick, easy, and absolutely delicious fish stew! Fresh fish fillets cooked in a stew with onions, garlic, parsley, tomato, clam juice and white wine.
meta_description.664: A flavorful marinade and a quick sear make for easy homemade chicken fajitas—onions and bell peppers help, too. This is a classic you can make yourself!
meta_description.665: If you can bake chicken, you can make dinner over and over again. This is a simple recipe with salt, pepper, and olive oil, but so versatile.
meta_description.666: Step-by-step detailed instructions and photos on roasting a goose.
meta_description.667: Yes, you really can make pizza out of cauliflower! This cauliflower crust is gluten-free, not hard at all to execute, and tastes great because you've made it yourself. Top it with any of your favorite pizza toppings and grab a slice!
meta_description.668: Here's an easy way to grill salmon without the fish sticking to the grates. Promise! And mix up your approach with 4 different marinades while you're at it.
meta_description.669: BBQ Pork "Country Ribs" - cut from the shoulder, cooked slow and low, and glazed with the barbecue sauce of your choice! This country-style ribs recipe teaches you all you need to know.
meta_description.670: This tomato galette with its crispy Parmesan whole wheat crust is almost too pretty to eat. Almost. Easy food processor crust. This is the perfect tart to serve all summer long.
meta_description.671: Baked white fish, such as cod, haddock, scrod, hake or bass, baked with a buttery Ritz cracker crust.
meta_description.672: Try these pulled pork tacos made with slow cooker Mexican pulled pork! The pork is rubbed with spices, slow-cooked, shredded and served with tortillas in tacos or burritos.
meta_description.673: Such a satisfying combo! Italian sausages cooked with bell peppers, sweet onions, crushed tomatoes, and garlic. Served on a hoagie roll or over pasta or polenta.
meta_description.674: Quick and easy shrimp scampi. Shrimp sautéed in easy scampi sauce with garlic, butter, olive oil, and white wine, tossed with red pepper flakes and parsley.
meta_description.675: This 1-pot ground turkey and peppers recipe is quick and easy! Sautéed ground turkey with onions, garlic, bell peppers, and seasoned with chipotle chili.
meta_description.676: Poach delicious salmon steaks or fillets in only 15 minutes! Salmon poached in white wine, seasoned with fresh dill.
meta_description.677: Ahi tuna, also known as yellowfin tuna, marinated in sesame oil, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, green onion, and lime juice, then pan seared.
meta_description.678: Have leftover rice and cooked salmon? Make salmon fried rice! Comes together in minutes. Easy and so good!
meta_description.679: Baked Spaghetti Casserole with thin spaghetti, sausage, mushroom, and tomato sauce, ricotta, Parmesan, and Mozzarella cheeses.
meta_description.680: Smoked salmon with pasta in a sauce of shallots, garlic, white wine, lemon, and cream, with toasted pine nuts and parsley.
meta_description.681: Eat Your Food! Think of pepperoni pizza, but as pasta! Kid-friendly, and parents can add some extra spice to their bowls with a crunchy breadcrumb topping.
meta_description.682: The English classic Toad-in-the-Hole—sausage links baked in a Yorkshire pudding like flour egg batter.
meta_description.683: Salad Nicoise, a French composed salad with tuna, green beans, hard boiled eggs, tomatoes, onion, capers, and potatoes.
meta_description.684: A traditional Louisiana gumbo served during Lent that is based on loads of greens such as collards, kale, turnip greens and spinach.
meta_description.685: This Stuffed Delicata Squash recipe is an elegant dinner party meal, but it's also easy enough to make on a weeknight. We're stuffing these with a mix of pancetta, goat cheese, rice, and mushrooms!
meta_description.686: Mexican cochinita pibil, or pulled pork shoulder marinated and braised in achiote paste, orange juice, and lime. Great for taco meat.
meta_description.687: Shrimp and grits is an iconic Southern dish and easy to make at home. Grits topped with shrimp, onions, peppers and bacon come together for this classic dish with great flavor.
meta_description.688: Classic bean and bacon soup with white beans, onion, celery, carrot, garlic, and plenty of bacon!
meta_description.689: Honey Mustard Salmon - this easy baked salmon recipe is an easy, delicious way to dress up salmon fillets! Takes only 20 minutes start to finish.
meta_description.690: Tostadas are meant to be messy! Pile them with your favorite toppings and dig in. These are made with a crispy fried corn tortilla topped with refried beans, grated cheese, chopped avocado and tomato, sliced lettuce, and salsa.
meta_description.691: A traditional French dish, mussels mariniere, or moules mariniere. Mussels steamed in white wine, served in sauce of juices from the mussels, wine, butter, and shallots.
meta_description.692: Poblano chiles, stuffed with cotija cheese and chorizo sausage, baked in an egg and cheese casserole with tomato sauce.
meta_description.693: Delicious Coconut Shrimp Curry! Quick and EASY, this shrimp curry dish with coconut milk is perfect for a midweek meal. ONE pot and it takes only 30 minutes to make, and that's starting with frozen shrimp!
meta_description.694: Hearty rabbit stew with fresh and dried mushrooms, parsnips, garlic, shallots, and sherry.
meta_description.695: Jackfruit makes an easy, meat-free meal any night of the week. Here, we're making tacos! Warm it up with your favorite BBQ sauce and pile it into tortillas with all your favorite toppings.
meta_description.696: This easy recipe for Tex-Mex cheese enchiladas is a family favorite! Just lightly fry corn tortillas, roll them up with Jack or cheddar cheese, cover with a tomato and green chile sauce, more cheese, and bake.
meta_description.697: How to make salmon patties with cooked salmon, bread, green onion, dill, bell pepper, egg, lemon, and paprika. These easy salmon cakes make a perfect midweek meal.
meta_description.698: Salmon stew based on Brazilian style moqueca fish stew. Salmon marinated in garlic, lime juice, paprika and cumin, the cooked with onions, bell peppers, tomato, cilantro, and coconut milk.
meta_description.699: Lamb chops are such a simple and satisfying meal. Marinate them in rosemary and garlic, sear them quickly on the stovetop, and dinner is served. Great for a romantic date night or a dinner party.
meta_description.700: Mexican Lasagna! Also known as Taco Lasagna or Mexican Casserole, this dish is layered with corn tortillas, ground beef, green chiles, beans, salsa, and cheese. A huge hit with a crowd! Perfect for potlucks.
meta_description.701: Roast wild duck, specifically teal, stuffed with rosemary, onion, apple, cloves, with a sauce of drippings, dry sherry and cream.
meta_description.702: Turn sweet potatoes and black beans into a simple, healthy dinner with these tacos! Ready in about 30 minutes. Top them with avocado, cilantro, salsa verde, or any favorite toppings.
meta_description.703: A classic French shellfish and fish stew recipe, prepared with the freshest possible seafood, caught and served the same day.  Served with a spicy sauce rouille.
meta_description.704: Marinated, slow-cooked, lamb stew with lamb shoulder, garlic, rosemary, onion, paprika, roasted bell peppers, tomato, parsley, red wine, and chicken stock.
meta_description.705: Warm up your winter with this cheerful ragout of roasted root vegetables with tomato and kale! It takes about as long to make as it does to roast the root vegetables. Hearty and nourishing.
meta_description.706: Baked ling cod recipe served with a lemon garlic butter sauce.
meta_description.707: New England Cioppino seafood stew with haddock, lobster, clams, and mussels. Perfect for a casual dinner party!
meta_description.708: This saffron-infused Seafood Paella is loaded with mussels, clams, and shrimp. Cook it on the grill for best flavor. It serves a crowd and would be so much fun for your next cookout!
meta_description.709: Boneless turkey breast pounded thin and stuffed with breadcrumbs, mushrooms, dried cranberries and sage, rolled and tied and roasted.
meta_description.710: Quick and easy! Shrimp marinated in a ginger sesame garlic soy sauce marinade, then quickly stir-fried.
meta_description.711: Calamari (squid) slow cooked in tomato sauce with onion, fennel, garlic, red wine, and parsley.
meta_description.712: Best turkey meatballs ever! Made with ground turkey, mushrooms, onions, and a touch of mayo, they are tender, flavorful, and not at ALL dry!
meta_description.713: Here's an EASY chili recipe to add to your list! It's made with black beans and ground turkey, and only takes 15 minutes to throw together. Make it to warm you up on a chilly winter day or for your next Super Bowl party!
meta_description.714: One-pot Curried Ground Turkey—ground turkey sautéed with onions and garlic, then simmered with Indian seasonings, potatoes, tomatoes, and peas.
meta_description.715: Rabbit, browned first in olive oil, then braised with onions, garlic, red bell peppers, mushrooms, tomatoes, and herbs.
meta_description.716: Crispy fried catfish fillets coated in a seasoned cornmeal crust!
meta_description.717: Slow roasted turkey wings, smothered in homemade turkey gravy. Pure comfort food!
meta_description.718: This leg of lamb is butterflied for easy grilling and marinated with rosemary and garlic to give it great flavor. Make it for a big summer cook-out, or even for a twist on Easter dinner.
meta_description.719: Spiralized zucchini noodles, baked in casserole with sausage tomato sauce, topped with ricotta, mozzarella, parmesan cheeses. Low carb and gluten-free!
meta_description.720: Sautéed salmon fillets served with a simple lemony cream sauce.
meta_description.721: EASY, hearty and simple Italian peasant stew with cabbage, parsley and Italian sausage.
meta_description.722: Turkey burger patties with grated zucchini, herbs, cumin, and cayenne, served with lemony sour cream sauce.
meta_description.723: Warm and hearty lentil stew with a bacon, onion, carrot, celery base, and Italian sausage and parsley.
meta_description.724: Petrale sole fillets, dusted in flour, sautéed in olive oil and served with a sauce of white wine, lemon juice, capers, parsley and butter.
meta_description.725: Kale sautéed with Italian sausage, onions, garlic and white beans. Quick and easy!
meta_description.726: Shrimp quesadilla! Flour tortillas toasted with shredded Monterey Jack cheese and pan-seared shrimp with onions, cilantro, avocados
meta_description.727: Easy grilled shrimp basted with garlic butter. It's shrimp on a stick!
meta_description.728: Turkey Stroganoff recipe made with turkey leftovers, mushrooms, thyme and sour cream.
meta_description.729: Classic French rabbit in Dijon mustard sauce, or Lapin à la moutarde.
meta_description.730: Quick and easy, shrimp baked in a tomato sauce with onions, garlic, parsley, dill, and feta cheese.
meta_description.731: Lamb Korma, Afghan style, lamb leg or shoulder slowly cooked in a stew with onions, tomato, spices and yogurt.
meta_description.732: If you have leftover turkey from Thanksgiving, make this White Turkey Chili! It's made with white beans, green chilis, garlic, and of course, turkey.
meta_description.733: In this installment of Eat Your Food! from our writer Nick Evans, he feeds his kids Ginger-Soy Steamed Salmon with Spicy Maple Sauce. Regardless of whether you have tiny mouths to feed, this cooks quickly in a steamer basket and makes for a well-rounded, flavorful dinner.
meta_description.734: These Sweet Potato Taquitos are vegan and baked instead of fried for a healthy riff on one of our favorite fried foods. They're just as crunchy and great with some cashew cream sauce on the side.
meta_description.735: Alaskan King Crab steamed briefly and served with melted butter.
meta_description.736: Get your power greens in this macaroni cheese! With loads of baby spinach, parsley, garlic, white sharp cheddar, Parmesan, and macaroni pasta.
meta_description.737: A classic Chinese stir fry of shrimp and snow peas with a mild ginger-garlic sauce.
meta_description.738: Turkey Meatloaf! Make it with grated zucchini and carrot for moisture and an extra serving of veggies, then brush some sweet chili sauce on top for flavor. Freezes and reheats beautifully.
meta_description.739: Goldfish Chicken Tenders are the ultimate kid-friendly snack that meets the ultimate kid-friendly dinner! These tenders are baked in the oven to crispy perfection. But guess what? Adults love them, too.
meta_description.740: Vegetarian Lasagna to feed a crowd! This one is filled with meaty shiitake and cremini mushrooms, spinach, and ricotta and Mozzarella cheeses. Your vegetarian and meat-eating guests will fight for seconds.
meta_description.741: The BEST Swedish meatballs recipe! Made from a mixture of beef and pork, flavored with nutmeg and cardamom and served with a tasty Swedish Meatball sauce.
meta_description.742: Get the best of Chinese Orange Chicken takeout at home! This recipe is loaded with sweet citrus flavors, sesame seeds, and scallions. It’s surprisingly easy to make. All you need is a large skillet. And don’t skip the orange zest in the sauce—it’s the most important piece!
meta_description.743: BEST Beef Noodle Casserole EVER! Our favorite recipe from my grandmother is this casserole with ground beef, egg noodles, onions, bell pepper, garlic, mushrooms, tomato, corn, olives, egg noodles and grated cheddar cheese.
meta_description.744: Make tandoori chicken on your grill! Chicken legs marinated in lemon juice, yogurt, and aromatic spices.
meta_description.745: Here's a from-scratch Chicken Pot Pie adapted from Marshall Field's classic recipe. With a slow-cooked chicken, a creamy vegetable filling, and a handmade pie crust, this pot pie is the ultimate comfort food.
meta_description.746: One pan? Yes, please! This French Herbes de Provence skillet chicken uses chicken tenders, potatoes, olives, and spinach make quick work for this weeknight, freezer friendly meal.
meta_description.747: Classic Mexican soup made with meatballs (albondigas), green beens, onions, and chicken stock. A family favorite.
meta_description.748: Make this easy Chinese takeout classic at home! This stir fry of chicken, mushrooms, and a sweet sauce comes together in about a half an hour. It's just as fast (or faster!) than having it delivered.
meta_description.749: Easy Turkey Chili, great for turkey leftovers! With shredded turkey meat, kidney beans, onion, garlic, tomatoes and chili.
meta_description.750: Dry-brined roasted chickens are the best way to get succulent, juicy meat, and crispy, golden skin! The best part? You only need 5 minutes and some space in the fridge!
meta_description.751: Go retro with this Brown Sugar Baked Ham with Pineapple! Massage brown sugar and spices into the ham 24 hours before you serve it. Cover with pineapple, and bake slow and low for a juicy, succulent Easter or Christmas ham.
meta_description.752: Chicken piccata gets the full pasta treatment! Cook the penne, make a quick butter sauce, and assemble it all together. This easy lemony chicken dish will wow your kids!
meta_description.753: This easy stovetop Chicken Tikka Masala tastes just like your favorite Indian take-out and is ready in under an hour. Leftovers are even better the next day!
meta_description.754: This easy, all-in-one Salmon Foil Packet with potatoes, snap peas, and tomatoes gets its spicy zing from Harissa paste, a North African spice mix. Baking in foil makes super-tender salmon and clean up is a snap! This dinner is designed to feed two, but it’s easy to scale up or down.
meta_description.755: Everything you ever wanted to know about making the very best grilled cheese sandwich! Mayo or butter? Open-faced or closed? Lid on or off? There's more to a good grilled cheese than you might think!
meta_description.756: Instant Pot Guinness Beef Stew! All the flavor of a slow-cooked stew, done in a fraction of the time in the pressure cooker. Made with beef stew meat, onion, celery, carrots, parsnips, and of course, Guinness. So good on a cold winter day.
meta_description.757: English Muffin Tuna Melts! If you've got the fixins for tuna salad, some cheese, and a few English Muffins, you've got dinner. With any luck, you've got dinner your kids will love, too.
meta_description.758: These Bang Bang Shrimp Tacos are a copycat of the ones from Bonefish Grill. Plump fried shrimp gets tossed in a spicy sriracha and chili garlic sauce. Consume immediately—you won't want to wait, anyway!
meta_description.759: These Turkey Sloppy Joes are family-tested and kid-approved, plus lean ground turkey is a great healthy option for weeknight dinners. Embrace the mess and your kids will, too!
meta_description.760: Turkey tetrazzini recipe, a turkey casserole with egg noodles, mushrooms, peas, Parmesan and Swiss cheeses, cream, bread crumbs and turkey.
meta_description.761: Pasta served with a sauce made with oil-packed canned tuna, onions, capers, white wine, and parsley.
meta_description.762: Shrimp Etouffee! This classic Louisiana stew is made with shrimp, the Holy Trinity of onion, celery, and green pepper, and a simple roux to thicken it up. Serve it over rice for a true Cajun meal!
meta_description.763: A quick and easy way of cooking lean flank steak on the stovetop.
meta_description.764: Traditional Mexican pozole (posole) is a rich, brothy soup made with pork, hominy, and red chiles. Pile your bowl with toppings like shredded cabbage, radishes, cilantro, lime, and avocado!
meta_description.765: Hearty White Bean and Ham Soup, perfect for cold winter days! White beans, ham shanks, onions, celery, carrots, garlic, Tabasco, and herbs make this delicious ham and bean soup a cool weather classic.
meta_description.766: Easy Chicken Piccata! Takes 20 minutes to make. Chicken breast cutlets, dredged in flour, browned, served with sauce of butter, lemon juice, capers, and stock or wine.
meta_description.767: Cooked low and slow on the stovetop, beef chuck or shoulder roast becomes a fall-apart tender pot roast. Onions, garlic, carrots, and red wine make this a satisfying, flavorful dinner.
meta_description.768: This Creamy Baked Mac and Cheese is just what your carb-loving soul needs! Macaroni bathed in rich, creamy cheese sauce topped with a flavorful breadcrumb topping and baked to perfection. Yes, please!
meta_description.769: My mother's tried and true roast turkey recipe. How to cook a turkey for Thanksgiving. Best way? Roast it Breast-side Down!
meta_description.770: There are never enough pasta recipes, right? Here's a quick one that combines creamy ricotta, spinach, and artichoke hearts, topped a crunchy mix of breadcrumbs and almonds.
